text:
Bottle systembolaget 
Slight hazy yellow towards orange, white head 
Aroma of sour cellar, peach lemon.
Taste sour, egg, peach. Tart and nice.

375 ml bottle, served in tumbler. Vintage: 2015. Poured clear golden amber with a small half finger off white head. Lively carbonation in glass. Aroma is stunning: citrus, barnyard, goat, blue cheese, green apples, cloves, basement, spruce, wet earth, oak barrel, leather, herbs. Taste: citrus, very sour, granny smith apples, tart, bitter, oak barrel, sour cherries, blue cheese, dusty basement, herbs, spruce, ginger, vinegar, vinous tannine. Bonkers sour with velvety sweetness. Very refreshing and absolutely delicious. Medium body with a supersour bittersweet finish. Now THIS is what you call a Gueuze, a real piece of art and a wonderful experience.
Flaska från SB. Guldfärgad med liten vit skumkrona. Gröna äpplen, päron, hö, stalltoner, hästfilt, nötig med inslag av sesamkaka, gröna vindruvor, fat, bra syrlighet.

La bière à boire comme un cidre. 

Fruitée, ronde en bouche, fraîche et légère, une des rares bières dont je peux boire la grande bouteille en entier sans sourciller. 

Plutôt dorée et plate, elle souvre sur une note de fruits frais, et puis une pointe dacidité pour retourner sur la touche équilibrée de bière vineuse. 

Outrageusement harmonieuse et riche, un must.

From a 375 ml bottle corked and caged bottle in 2012. Pours a clear copper with a thin off white head. Aroma of barnyard and citrus. Flavors of grapfruit and tart grapes. Mellowed and smooth with bottle age.

pours a golden yellow,thin white head
 Aroma citrus lemon lime bit musty
 taste is sourish dry plenty of lemon
 long dry tart finish
Orange colour, quite yeasty and tarty. Mild sourness. Surprisingly drinkable.

0,375 bottle, 2011 vintage, 13/05/17. Pours a slightly orange with some white bubbles, fizzy. Aroma is sour, slight caramel, some lemon, leather. Taste is sour, funk, some lemon, slight bile and barnyard. Very good, excellent.
Aroma: funky, yellow fruits, sourness, some wood and hay. Taste: nice sourness, funky, lemon, apricot, herbs, vinegar. Medium quickly disappearing head, poor lacing and medium to high carbonation.
Aromatic intense sour. Hazy golden with white head. Intense sour freshness & a low sweetness. Medium body, creamy texture & average carbonation.

Bottle at t Brugs Beertje, Bruges. Clear golden with white head, fizzy. The aroma has lots of brett, garlic, yeasts, wood and minerals. Very sour flavor with notes of brett, garlic, lemon, onion, dry. Lively carbonation, medium-bodied.
Bottle at t Brugs Beertje. Clear orange with a huge head. Aroma of herbs, Brett, wet leafs. Sour, lemon, citrus, herbs, oak. Light-bodied, dry. Good.

Pours hazy darker gold with a small white head which dissipated quickly. Aroma is sour, earthyness, musty and woody. Taste is tart with a sweet citrus finish. Dry and crisp, very nice. As it warmed the funkyness increased.

Aroma: The apple is sour, a little mold, the farmyard.
Appearance: Yellow, slightly cloudy without foam
Taste: Sour apple, plum
Palate: Light body, light carbonation, long dry finish.
Hazy amber colour. Active carbonation. Colossal and bubbly off-white head that vanishes within seconds. Aroma is hay, peanut butter, and musk. Taste is peach and lemon with a tart, earthy finish.

Bottle at home. Vintage 2014. Now three year old. Has a slightly hazy amber colour with a very small off-white head. Aroma of oak, apple cider vinegar, rowan berries, dried apricot, barnyard and forest floor. Has a sour flavor of vinegar, barnyard, lemon juice, grass and ends more fruity with apricots. Has a slick mouth feel, medium body and a light bitterness. The aroma is filled with horse. Quite sour taste with fruity undertones. Solid gueuze but lacks a little complexity.
2016 37.5cl bottle. hazy orange, small white head. apples, brett, lemon, grapefruit, vinegar. medium tart ending with medium carbonation. nice.
Dark blond with lasting thin head. Aroma has lots of horsey, farmyard, bacteria and manure. Flavour is much more balanced. Touches of funk. Nicely dry.
Backlog. Herbal, hay, vinegar, fruity(citrus, pineapple). Medium sour, acidic.

Aroma is very nice, very herbal (with mint, sage, basil), behind those is a lot of hay, some funk and a bit of vinegar (sweet, balsamic vinegar smell).
In flavor theres a bit too much of the vinegar.
Still, quite a good gueuze, not the fruity type.

[2012] 750ml bottle. Hazy orange with a foamy white head. Flavors are peach, oak, lemon, acetone and funk with mineral and earthy notes. Moderate lactic and acetic acidity. Light to medium body, soft carbonation, slick texture.

375ml bottle. Pours rather hazy pale orange, small white head. Aroma is tart, green apple, elderflower, hints of vinegar. Taste is sharp, woody, raw apple, vinegar, white currant. Long tart aftertaste, lots of barrel and tannins, some peach. Medium bodied, below average carbo. Woody, robust gueuze!
Sampled from a bottle at Zmogsala beer festival. OK funky gueuze, medium sourness, bit of fruitiness, ok tart finish, not very intensive.
Bottle - Lots of funk, petroleum, and some barrel. Cloudy Gil with a nice white head. Funk, fruit and petroleum. So solid.  As it warms some great nectarine notes.
Lightly hazy gold with the fainest wisp of foam. Tart citrus, green apple and light earthy funk.
Rating #3400. From a green 750ml bottle. Gold with no head. Nose has lemony sourness and sweaty notes. Taste is sweaty, tart, lemony. Nice texture, extremely drinkable.

pours slightly hazy golden yellow with no head and basically no carbonation. Other reviews mention average carbonation, so I wonder if my bottle just was not properly sealed. The aroma is tart and funky, reminding me of kombucha, sour apples, some hints of the aging. The flavor is very good in spite of this bottle being mostly flat. It is very sour and strong, with pear and citrus and lemon qualities, and the close is bright and pungent. I liked this.

pours almost clear golden orange with a frothy and creamy eggshell white head offering good retention and lacing. tart apricots, pickled clementines, light to medium acidity - powdery citric acid with soft acetic edge, never overwhelming; definitely a funky one, golden if not very lightly caramelized fruitiness, two scoops of salt, lime zest. bright to moderate carbonation, light body - oily; dry, tart and woody-citrusy finish. zesty/vibrant lemony notes, more than enought funk,good drinkability - much enjoyed this sunday winter quencher.
Wood, wine and sourness in aroma. Same elements in the taste with addition of Brett. Very nice
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Poured a mostly clear golden orange with minimal head and lacing. Aroma of wood and tart apples. Taste is moderately sour with lemon and apples, wood and straw. Finishes with a mouth watering tartness. Light bodied with medium carbonation. Nice moderate level of tartness that encourages another drink but doesnt completely overwhelm the other flavors.
750ml bottled Nov 2015. Pours a pale brown color with a little froth on top. Mild carbonation. Some nice gueuze bitumen flavor. But the flavor dies quickly leaving it a little watery.
UPDATED: JAN 10, 2017 Wow. Funky indeed. Flat. Slightly flowery. Bubbly water. Aftertaste is helping. Sweet. Boring. Bread. Hnngh.

Clear golden yellow beer which looks like whisky with no head at all. Aroma has green apples which are sour, hint of barnyard. Taste is sour with green apples and slight yeast but too mellow for me 
Nothing stands out here. Medium body and high carbonation. Sadly nothing stands out here.

06-JAN-2016, bottle @Ulkløbben meeting, @Frank.
Hazy orange with a low White head.
Funk, lemon, apples, Wood. Tart. Really tasty. Nice.

Bottle from online shop. Amber color, white head. Sour taste with citrus, wheat, tart, acidic notes, sour apples, oak and grass. Well-balanced body. Sour finish with citrus, tart, sour apples, a bit of oak and grass. Excellent gueuze.
bottle, thanks to kappldav123! Hazy golden with a fluffy white head. Tart and quite sour start with a vinegary touch. Shy barnyard flavours tune in, woody-dusty hops in the finish.
Pachnie kombinacją mokrego konia i odgrzebanego po 10 latach z piwnicy skórzanego buta, w smaku bije kwasem, to chyba jest ok ;) W smaku podobnie. Generalnie mocne w każdą stronę.
Pours golden with a white head. Aroma is sour lactic. Taste is mild acidic, soft, apple, vinegar, sweetish, citrus

UPDATED: DEC 13, 2016 Light amber color with short white head that dissipates. Smell of horse manure, mold, strawberry, berries, citrus, salinitylactic acid, soap, burnt plastic overtones. Taste is salty, tart, light sweet, earthy-soil notes, citrus, acidity is quite strong. Aftertaste is tart with mainly soap and lemon notes. Low carbonation, medium body. A solid and complex brew but Ive tried better from Hanssen...

Une gueuze qui na jouit daucun traitement particulier, qui nest pas rare, qui nest pas cher et aucunement prisé. Pourtant une gueuze absolument délectable! La robe est foncée, trouble, et aucunement mousseuse. Janticipe une barrique qui a donné tout ce quelle avait au liquide. Arômes terreux, fruités et poussiéreux à souhait, le tout bien balancé et complexe. Dominantes boisée et vanillée en bouche allégée par une douce effervescence. Corps ample pour le style, longue en bouche et chargée de saveurs issues dune flore bactérienne mature et colorée. Une grand plaisir à déguster!

Bottle from SB. Clear yellow, white head. BF in 2034. Lovely funky, apricot, citrusy, barn, funk aroma. Sour tart taste, superdry with hints of elderflower. Demanding and complex geuze, took a while for me to like this beer but now its awesome.

Color dorado, algo turbio, sin espuma. Carbonatación mínima. Aroma ácido, sidroso. Sabor a manzana muy ácida, acidez, acidez (hay más frutas pero no las capto)... Entiendo que a muchos no les guste. Para mí es una pasada.

750ml bottle. Pours a hazy medium gold, with a small white head, which fades rather quickly, without leaving much lacing. Good sourness, leathery funk and some cut grass and cranberry hints in the aroma. Strongly sour up front, with tart citric notes. A touch of tannin and leathery funkiness in the mid-palate, tart berry notes coming through to the finish. There is a drying, leathery aftertaste. A nice gueuze.

Bottle.Pours hazy yeloow with nice white head. Aroma: sourish, cow shit, hay, apple peals, raw berries-nice. Taste: medium sour, raw apples, weak hay, acidity, Up to medium body. Sour finish. Well balanced. I like it.Really good with a hangover.

A 375ml corked and caged bottle with a notched bottled on dating of November 2015, poured into a Cantillon gueuze glass. It poured a slightly hazy golden colour with an almost two finger white head that dissipated quickly to a thin layer while leaving no lacing. Aromas were sour, tart, funky and oaky with hints of apple and lemon. Tastes sour and tart to start followed by lemon, pear and sour apple fruitiness. The finish has some light funk, a touch of vinegar and nice oakiness. Dry, acidic, medium to light bodied with moderate to high carbonation. Overall one of the more sour Gueuzes out there, but still very nice and enjoyable.

Lambica clásica muy bien hecha. Tomada en Olut (Sabadell)
Very well done classic Lambica.
Aroma: quite acidic, roasted poppy seeds, green apples and Brett funk. Taste: light berries, bright funk, white wine. Overall: fantastic geuze. Pick it up if you see it.

2 finger white head, amber body. Nose: Vinegar, green apples, barnyard, yeast, lemon, bitter gooseberries and grapefruit. Taste: Vinegar, green apples, lemon, grapefruit, bitter gooseberries,  the slightest hint of parmigiano reggiano, yeast and barnyard-notes. Long tart ending with some bitterness.
Bottle at WTWBA. Dark golden pour, acidic aroma, taste follows. Good but too acidic.
UPDATED: OCT 29, 2016 Robe dorée orangé. Mousse beaucoup. Nez aigre et vinaigré. Superbe en bouche, acide, citron vert, boisé. Excellent

0.75l bottle. Clear golden body, thin white head. Huge barnyard notes in the aroma escorted by vinegar, lemon zest, salt and earth. Taste of cheese, salt, vinegar, dark sugar and lemon zest. Very sour and the finish is quite bitter (not hoppy, more like when you are chewing on lemon peel). Almost totally flat. Awesome gueuze.

duft:citrus lysvindruger cider funk syre, 
smag citrus lime tør sur lidt vin æblecider

W aromacie dzikutki jak należy, nieco skórzany, siano, niewielka owocowość. W smaku podobnie, przeważa czysta dzikość, lekko owocowa kontra, poziom kwaśności niski jak na styl, pije się bardzo lekko i gładko. Bardzo dobry, ale nie porywający.

Bottle. Etre Gourmet. Orange gold. Soft haze. Film and ring of lasting, white head. Nose has unripe apple. Apple core. Lime juice. Salty and mineraly. Some stone fruit earthiness. Some cellar funk. Taste is mineraly and dry, and lightly salty. Some lime juice bitterness. Light to medium body. Light acidity. Bright fizz. Dry, lightly acidic, juicy finish. Nicely juicy with soft acidity.
Wazig goudblond bier met weinig wit schuim. Geur: zurig, citrus, wat hout. Smaak: citroen zuur en wat tannine. Redelijke koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: licht zuur maar lang.
[backlog] 09-04-16 // bottle at home. Bought in Belgium. Light hazy dark orange colour, small white head. Very tart. Some citrus grass and hay aromas. Sour fnish.

75cl. Pours a slightly hazy golden apricot orange with small head and nice carbonation. Aroma: sweet Geuze sourness and tartness, strong malt character, some lime and maybe even cilantro, light yoghurt note. Taste: Very drinkable Geuze with medium tartness, not as acidic as some of the other brands. Mouthfeel, although still very much like a Geuze, is almost doughy. Has a definite sweet touch. In development, some lime and lemon, malts, cactus. Light dry mouthfeel with again some sweet, malty notes.

375ml corked and caged bottle purchased at the Wine and Cheese Place in Clayton, Missouri. The pour is a hazed orange golden with a foamy one inch white head the falls with big bubbles. The aroma is lemon citrus funk, barnyard, and hay all fully integrated and nicely layered. The taste is clean citrus floral at first, moving to lemon tartness and closing with the funk and leather. Nice flavor transitions. The palate is light to medium bodied, with fine active carbonation and a clean dry finish with funk pleasantly lingering.

Style et résumé: Oude gueuze de grande qualité.
Comment:  Bouteille de 37,5cl meilleure avant 07/08/2034.
Description:  Une gueuze dorée foncée qui ne mousse pas vraiment. Un nez agréable aigre et légèrement vinaigré. La bouche est superbe, ronde (pour une gueuze) mais pas sucrée, longue, acide et légèrement acidulée. Jadore. Bien content de reboire cette bière que jai eu la chance de boire en 1994 quand le nom Hanssens napparaissait que sur le bouchon de liège.
Note: 8+/10
Couleur dorée-orangée, forte mousse blanche. Nez typique aigre acidulé, avec citron vert et vieux fut. Gout bien amere acide, vieux citron, boisé, pomme verte, sec. Nickel mais pas assez complexe

Sample from 375 ml bottle at CBWF 2016. Slightly hazy golden colour with a thin, white head. Tart aroma with lemons, wooden notes, barnyard, smelly socks and wheat malts. Taste is sour. Medium body with a creamy texture and a soft carbonation. Finishes dry and tart fruity with yeasts and lemons. Lovely Lambiek.
375ml från systembolaget. En helt ok öl lagrad ca 1 år. Hade förväntat mig mer ändå.

A 0.375 l bottle. It poured a hazy golden body with medium sized head. Nice fruity aroma, especially tart apples, also vinegar, leather and light grain. Flavor was sour of course, with especially strong sour punch at the beginning that soon dissipated leaving quite a long appleish finish. These underripe, green nice apples typical for the style. Very light salt at the very end. Thinner in body. I didnt really perceive it as complex, just the opposite, but nevertheless, it was a very pleasant and nice lambic!

Bardzo solidny lambik. Aromat raczej mało intensywny, pomimo wysokiego wysycenia, wyczuć można drewno, owoce (pomarańcz?) i delikatną kwasowość. Wygląda całkiem fajnie, ciemnosłomkowa barwa, przechodząca wręcz w mętną pomarańcz przykryta jest gęstą pianą, która zostaje do końca degustacji. W smaku jest bardzo świeże, rześkie, ale co jakiś czas wychodzą nuty bardziej wytrawne, winne, taninowe. 
Podsumowując, wyszedł tutaj bardzo orzeźwiający lambik, ale potrafiący zaoferować coś więcej, niż nuty kwaśne i owocowe, przez co nie jest jednowymiarowy i nie nudzi się w miarę picia. Warto spróbować.

Barwa złota, opalizująca. Aromat winogronowo cytrynowy, są oczywiście nuty skóry, starego drewna i białego wina. W smaku mocno kwaśne, cytrynowe, ze sporą ilością tanin od beczki, lekką dzikością i posmakiem kociej kuwety. Spod tej kwaśności majaczy też gronowa słodycz i pestkowa cierpkość... Goryczki brak. Wysycenie średnie do wysokiego, lekko szczypiące. Szorstkie i rześkie w odbiorze.
Specyficzne, ewidentnie kwaśne, z nieco nieprzyjemnym posmakiem, ale za to bardzo orzeźwiające i wyraziste Gueuze... No cóż, ma to swój urok :)

Deep golden color, almost 100% clear. One finger white head, surprigsinly persistant. Beautiful carbonation is constantly flowing up. Awesome sour and tart aroma with notes of lemon and lime juice. In the back also some wooden-like notes. Taste amazing. Sour, tart, with a lot of barrel, wild, sulfor flavours. Ridiculously drinkable, super refreshing, highly carbonated. Great beer!

Enormous thanks heavy! Shared with him & others. Almost clear, slightly hazy golden body with a tiny white head with medium retention. Lovely, complex lambic aroma, fruity notes, hay, dry pungent perfumey notes, apple core, some burnt grain. Not much different in the taste, yeah, with a good, but far from excessive sour base, but with some sweetish overtones or at least feelings, somewhat creamy, blueberry & apple hints here and there, slightly salty at points, some light popcorn at others, dry and bitter at times, everything really. Nice, very complex, tasty. Superb, simply superb.
Bottle. Hazy straw gold pour, with a white head. Lemon, hay, grain, mild horse blanket, funk, green apple, and some notes of cheese. Nice beer, not the best gueuze, but good.

Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, fruit, brettanomyces and acidity.

Appearance:

Turbid golden/amber beer with a slight off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel and fruit; ends medium dry and sour with brettanomyces and acidity.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. Really malty for a Geuze, but it still manages to be extremely complex.

Draft to tulip
Consummation: Tart grapefruit loaded with musty grape.
Adjunct: Heavy horse blanket, grapefruit, and a hint of green apple; translucent amber with a happy white and frothy head; medium bodied, sour, quite smooth and long lasting; pretty damn good

Pours somewhat cloudy golden with a medium unstable white head. A very clean brett/lactic aroma. A clean dry taste, no excess sourness. Wonderful crispy dry palate. I love the taste and the palate but the aroma seems too clean to me, lacking some "perk".

(37.5 cl. Bb: 07/08/2034) Une robe orangée et une mousse absente. Au nez, des parfums de vinaigre, de cave humide, de pommes avec une touche de solvant. Une bouche acide plus ou moins décapante qui laisse une impression vinaigrée durable. Le corps sans bulle ou presque et la texture légèrement huileuse peuvent être aisément associés au style. Buvable, il va sans dire. Excellent? Je ne suis pas prêt à me rendre là.
Flaska från SB. Orange, disig kulör med lätt smutsvit skumkrona. Doft av citrus, äppelkart och stall. Syrlig och sprittsig kropp. Smak av citrus, äppelkart, vinäger och lite funk.

Barwa złocista, lekko zamglona. Piana obfita, ale szybko znika. Aromat zdecydowanie kwaśny, dominują niedojrzałe owoce: winogrona, brzoskwinie. W smaku jest mocno kwaśne, dalej bardzo owocowe, na końcu pojawia się lekko słodka nuta.

Tart, complex full nose with touches of citrus, lemon / grapefruit. Some musty wordiness. Pours reddish golden with very little foam and some gunk on the bottom. Medium / light body with little fizz. Dramatic grapefruit sourness. Very dry astringent finish with some woody elements behind. Excellent sour with little trace of sweetness. Corked bottle.
Bottle sample tasted at BBF Lab Madrid 2016 on the 02/07/2016. Hazy amber colour with a minimal white head. Sour aroma and taste. Fruits and tart. Next one please!
Bottle from Ellwood Thompsons. Hazy golden with thin head and sediment. Smells aggressively tart. Very tart and robust. Definitely sour.

UPDATED: JUN 25, 2016 375ml Bottle, bottled probably in 2014 judging by expiration date, bought at Sterk Amsterdam, consumed 25.06.2016, temp 5C. Smell is chemical solvent funk, taste is malty green apple sour, no bitterness, very acidic, low carbonation. Definitely not my favorite gueuze. Could be this bottle was not kept at optimum conditions in the store though.

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2017 "Pours" a very clear golden with a medium-high bubbly white head that leaves good lacing. Nose is of barnyard, light cork, light cheese and just better than I expected overall (all the other Hanssens Ive had so far were acetic bombs it seems). Taste is moderately acidic and really dry. Some nice tannic oak. Some cereals in the finish. Body is light to medium, carbonation moderately light but still festive and the dry/tannic impression is long lasting. A nice gueuze that is up there with most other blenderies. I will gladly stock a few of these from now on!
375ml bottle. Pours almost clear deep golden colour with small white head. Aroma of tart fruits, pale malt, glue, vanilla. Taste of sour malt, pale fruits, wood, herbs, nice!

Un nez des plus parfait pour un amateur de gueuzes: ça sent si complexe... Les notes décurie sont bien présentes mais adoucies par un côté fruité prononcé mais non sucré. Le visuel est très normal, très quelconque même... Mais cest un classique avec les lambics et il ne faut surtout pas sarrêter là en dégustant une bière de ce style! Limpression en bouche est étonnement peu pétillante: Il doit y avoir beaucoup de vieux lambics dans la batche doù provient ma bouteille. Cela dit, passant aux choses sérieuses: cest absolument exceptionnel au niveau des saveurs! Une des meilleures gueuzes qui mait été donnée de boire! Les notes sauvages mais fruitées volent de toutes parts et le côté sûrette est intense mais vraiment très bien intégré. Wow, jaime énormément! Merde, ma bouteille est déjà finie! :-(

Hazy to cloudy orange color, big white head. Sour aroma, wooden barrel, some wine and lots of yeast. Spicy taste, cloves, heavy sourness with little bit of sweetness in the background. Medium body, lively carbonation. Yes, thats a good one. //bottle at Craft Room

Bottle, 375 ml. Pours clear amber with quite a bit of white head and lots of visible carb. Quite sour and tart on the nose as expected - mostly sour green apple with a hint of lemon - but theres also a quite a lot of garden notes here- , pungent herbs, and almost something earthen, which compete with the initial tart characteristics. Usual barnyard yeast and hay notes, hints of mature cheese. Taste is quite sour with green apple or cider vinegar, with little hints of mint and toothpaste and a tiny bit of honey sweetness and cereal lingering in the finish. Sourness is not too strong. Light to medium body - reasonably thick texture and sharp, vibrant carbonation that sticks around a while. Finish is bone dry. Great balance of complexity and refreshment to be found here.

75cl bottle shared at home. Not sure on the bottle date but I guess its about two years old. Clear orange golden with fizzy white head that almost disappears completely. Strong funk, lemon, hay but also still drying or brooding hay, fresh wood, orange rind, straw, old dusty herbs. Strong in the funk and the complex fermenting grass notes, though there is also soft dusty animal sweat notes. Medium sour and bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. Lovely gueuze, I can drink this all day every day.

Bottle at home. Pours a clear golden with a white head. Dry and tart with a light sweetness. Aromas of sour malts and cask wood. Also notes of vinegar and hints of black pepper. Medium to light bodied. Medium carbonation. Dry and tart finish.
Bottle at BGBB3 bottle share, sample. Pours hazy dark yellow. Lovely balanced gueuze with barnyard funk, wood, apple, citrus, light bready notes. Good stuff.
Bottle - pours hazy orange. Aroma is funk, tart, straw and cidery. Taste is refeshing sour from start to finish.
Bottle 37.5 @ Lambizoon Milano. Wonderful geuze. Tart, sharp. Incredebly drinkable.
Bottle.Clear orange colour with no head.Aroma is tart of apples and vinagar flavor of hay and citrus,good dry mouthfeels and nice sour and dry finish.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2016 Pours a hazy orange gold with virtually no head. Musty; damp hay and tart apple peel. Tart; cider vinigar and green apple flavour. Settles nicely if allowed to rest before drinking.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 butelka, zeszloroczne chyba. aromaty mocno dzikie, nieco kiszonej kapusty czy tam ogorkow, nieco owocow typowo lambikowych. w smaku wytrawne, mocno kwasne cytrynowo.... sumarycznie dosc intensywne, ale takie... chamskie w tej swojej lambiowatosci w odbiorze. moze i to nie zarzut, ale po mojemu odstaje in minus troszke od pozostalych podstawowych wersji z okolicznych lambikarniOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Bottle shared @ Mikkeller Bar, Aarhus. Pours hazy orange with a medium fizzy white head. Aroma is mouldy, citrussy, hay, peach. Taste is citrussy, lemon zesty, hay, mushroom, funk, light vinegary, green apples. Carbed da fok out.

Appearance: orange cloudy color. minimal head.
Aroma: Malt vinegar, stable, hay, cowdung.
Taste: strong acidity! not for pussys!
Palate: full body.sticky texture. fizzy carbonation. medium long acidic finish.
Overall: good geuze, would never turn down this beer. especially not to fishnchips. Refreshing!
Pilsnerfärgad lite oklar med vit skum. Doftar och smakar äpple, lite spannmål, jäst, ek och funkigt. Riktigt fräsch!

Pour: Clear, light orange, high lumpy foam, soapy bubbles
Smell: barnyard, fruit, musty, hay, fresh, sour apple, slight cheese
Initial taste: aggressive mouthfeel, tart, bitter
After airing - First: tart, vinegar, carbonation dominates; mids: sour apple, citrus; after: barnyard, malt, bitterness
Verdict: Aggressive initial mouthfeel when put into mouth, but very balanced thereafter. Developed really well, after about 45 minutes the taste was very well balanced and much of the aggressiveness (maybe due to the carbonation having fallen quite a bit) and bitterness had dissipated.
Bottle from Systembolaget. Tart smell, with oak and some funk. Very tart taste with citrus, grape and funk. Very refreshing. Nice!
Flaska från SB. Dimmigt ljusorange med lite vitt skum. Syrlig doft. Sötsur smak med torr munkänsla.
375ml bottle. Hazy amber body with a low brief white head. Youghurt, stable,citrus, hint of mandarine, raw rhubarb stalks and green apples.
appear golden with a light tan. aroma, green apple, hay, horse, really dry, heavy sour. full bodied lively carbonation.

Taste: super sour,earthy with notes of apples, grapes, and yeast.
Complex yeasty nose. Deep amber color, semi opaque with nice laced head. Medium/full body
grass, citrus, herbs, hay, barnyard, earthy, woody, golden, hazy, white foam, medium sweetness, medium sourness, medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish, nice.

Sampled from a 12.7 oz green corked bottle this beer poured a hazy yellow gold color with a huge foamy orange-white head that lingered but left minimal lacing. The aroma was very funky, perfumey, floral and musty with a citric pez note. The flavor was tart and dryish with lemon, perfume, pez, chalk and a bit of funk. Long finish. Medium body. A bit disappointing.

Bottle, quite large, shared with a friend at The Foundry. Excellent gueuze, very well balanced and drinkable. Im afraid that I will never be able to reach the Beer Advocate level ofappreciation, so herewith: "The beer pours a hazy apricot and copper color, hazy and cloudy with a big, foamy, white head, solid retention but no lace. The aroma is great, loads of funk, straw, dead leaves but with some citrus peel, tropical fruit, soft pitted stone fruits, peppercorn and a bit of musty oak. The flavors are very nice, pleasant tart citrus, light grassy and earthy hoppiness, strong funky horseblanket, light stone fruits, musty oak, peppercorn, lingering wheat character, great balance and nice brightness that compliments the delicate nature of this beer. The mouthfeel is great, really lively, crisp, smooth, coating, medium body, lightly puckering bite at the finish." Lovely, undeniably earnest and right on the mark! Yeah, I dug this one and am planning a return to Belgium to live out my days drinking their many unbelievable brews...

Aroma - dry white flesh fruit, spiced wheat, funk, sweat, must, and lactobillus yeast.
Appearance - the body is slightly hazed sunglow. The nucleation is good, bubbles rising, and also clinging to the glass. The head is 1/4" and white, and settles into a thin film.
Taste - has abundant spiced wheat, barnyard, must, dry white flesh fruit, and lactobillus yeast. Nothing is overdone, and the balance is very nice. Overall its hardly sour, just a kind touch. There isnt much in the way of tartness. Its a unique showcase of the magic without being stereotypical.
Palate - light body, vinuous texture, lively carbonation, and dry slightly sour finish.
Pale golden no head. Dry and tart with a waxy body. Very old stinky aroma. A bit funky and sour and not in a delicious way.

The aroma is the best quality of this beer: very powerful and pleasant. No head. Very soft carbonation. Compared to ( at least most ) other 100% lambiek gueuzes, this is noticably the most sour one. Complexity and aftertaste are there but require some "active" tasting, you really need to let it flow over your tongue.  For me my least favorite old gueuze. Still a very good beer though.
Hazy orange liquid, no head. Fruity aroma. Light body, little bit carbonation. Taste is sour and a bit sweet.

0,375 bottle. Golden yellow colour. Quite high head, which disappears quite quickly. Aroma already in the nose then poured out into glass. Peachy, cheesy notes. Grass, vinegar, hints of flowers. Sour, woody at first. Hints of vinegar, apples, peach in the middle. Spicy and crisp finish. Oakiness and apples in the aftertaste. Nicely balanced gueuze. Tasty.
Pours a cloudy, amber color with a thin, white head. Wild, sour aroma with some oak and slight horse blanket. Sour flavor with the oak and wild yeast.

375ml bottle from Mikkeller webshop. Golden amber colour, foamy white head and aroma of grain, citric, funky. Flavour is sour, grains, lemon rind, tangy, vinegar, dry, barnyard funk. Slick mouthfeel, spritzy carbonation, drying tart finish. Very drinkable.

375ml bottle (thanks martjoobolut). BB 2034. Clear amber color. No head. Acidic, yeast, papery, nutty in aroma. Acidic, jammy, apples, peaches in taste. Holy moly! Dissolves my teeth. Omg! Way too acidic for me. Good potential thou. 6/3/6/3/13=3.1
375ml bottle (thanks FatPhil). Clear amber color. No head. More nutty, fruity, acidic, papery in aroma. More peaches in taste. Still acidic. Still sharp. Hmmm nah. Not for my taste.
Bottle, 375 ml from one of the Zagreb beershops. Shared with JFK10000. Pours clear golden with white head. Acidic, fruity, apples, wood. Bit of sulfur?. Lots of carbonation. Dry finish.

375ml bottle - thanks martjoobolut! (6:3:7:3:14=3.3)
Extremely sharp aroma, almost vinegary. Extremely sharp taste, but very nice apricot still remains. Sour dominated, but deep down theres a fullness in the wood esters that makes you love it!
Rerate: 375ml bottle (?, ?) (7:3:7+:4:15=3.6+)
Very nicely mellowed. Lovely apricot. Sourness still there. of course. Dang, magnificent, Apricot all over the finish. Aging worked wonderfully.

BB 2034, shared by Mart. Almost clear amber beer, no head. Nose is tart, fruity, apples, sharp. Flavor is fruity, mango, woody, sharp tartness, balsamico. Very sharp, has a nice fruityness to it, but damn its sharp.  BB 2027, shared by Phil. Clear amber, no head. Nose is less fruity, but still tart and sharp. Flavor is tart, apples, lots of wood and balsamico. Still sharp, but slightly more mellow. Not quite my cup of tea, but interesting.

UPDATED: MAR 26, 2016 Bb 2034. Pours golden with whiteish head. The head doesn?t stay. Aroma is sour, vinegar, funk. Flavor is sour, fruits, acidic, vinegar, lemon, some wheat notes. Overall: too acidic for my taste, but still better than lacto nonsenss.
Bb 2027, shared by fatphil, thanks. Aroma is mellower, less fruity, less funky, apricots. Flavor is more acidic, more berries, more vinegar, less sweetness. Overall: more vinegar, less fruity, i like it less than younger version. Rating for the old version: 5:3:5:3:12.
Transparent, golden, very sparkling, with good white foam. Aroma: brett, vinegar, acidity, a little barnyard, lemon. Taste: moderate acidity, wildness, lemon, fruit, malt, quite smoothly and soft.
Bottle. Orange color and small white head. Aroma of barnyard, lactic acid, vinegar, lemon. Taste is strong sour, dry, harsh with vinegar sweetness. Flavor of wine vinegar, lactic lemon, sour apples.

Lightly hazy amber pour with rocky white head. Soapy lacing. Aroma is tart green apple, barnyard funk, and earthy. Taste is lemon peel, funk, green apple, hay, and dusty. A little pucker in the finish. Very dry.

Bottle
Aroma-barnyard, earthy
Appearance-golden, hazy, white foam, 
Taste-medium sourness, lightly bitter, light sweetness, 
Palate-medium body, slick feel, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-refreshing

LOL "TOP 50" in style, while being 59th percentile.
Not the most impressive version - kinda like a starter geueze. Had some lemony acidic tartness but is missing the layers of the better examples. Some hay and farm as well. OK, but a one timer for the price.

This is quite light but fulfilled taste beer. A bit on the acidic side but that brings out all the undertones.
Very refreshing.
Bottle at mentalist institution tasting. Pours clear golden yellow with no head. Aroma is vinegar and barnyard. Taste is mild vinegar, lemon sour, lime sour, green apple sweet,

Bottle @VilleVallaPub, pours light hazy orange with small white head. Aroma of hay, grass, tart apples, funk and some lemon/citrus peel. Light body, quite flat, some carb. Taste is funky, grassy, citrusy, sour green apples some vinegar. Nice.

Franchement, je suis un peu déçu. Dès louverture de la bouteille, le "poup" à peine perceptible laisse déjà entrevoir une faible carbonation. Je nai donc pas été surpris de voir quaucune mousse ne se forme. Arômes fruitées et un petit je-ne-sais-quoi un peu désagréable (bactérie? Fût de chêne?). Sûre en bouche et pas trop mal, sauf de nouveau cet arôme désagréable, quoique heureusement subtile. Pas ma lambic préférée.
37,5 cl bottle. Hazy orange with a thin head. Classic aroma, funky barnyard, sour apples, vinegar. Taste is dry and moderately sour. Thin body, very soft carbonation. A light gueuze.

Orange/clear amber with a white ring of foam.
Tart aroma with ripe pears, green apples, hay, grass, very fresh and crisp.
Taste is dry, light woody with green apples and the white part of citrus fruit peel, whatever thats called. 
Light body and carbonation, dry.
For the price, the taste is too light/faint. Aroma is really good though.

Pours a rather pale amber to orange body with a very small, white, short-lived head that doesnt leave any lacing. Looks like a fruit juice... Rather strong aroma of funk, vinegar, apple cider vinegar and and sour fruits. The vinegar is very much present in the strong and funky flavour as well, a little bit too present for my taste. Also sweet and sour fruits, fermented apples and apple cider vinegar. Hints of fermented red berries. Moderate sour taste, traces of sweetness, long finish. Quite light body, dry and with a moderate carbonation. Interesting brew, but too focused on the vinegar. 
[37.5 cl bottle, enjoyed 18 years before BB date, courtesy of my father]
Aroma of sour appleskins, grains and some peach. The taste is sour and funky with quite a good amount of fruityness. very balanced.

Bouteille 75cl de et partagée avec Tderoeck.
Orangée, col fin blanc.
Arôme offre un bouquet funk, grains plaisant, fruité versant sur des effluves citronnées, retro boisé.
Palais au prpofil de cuire, lambic, sec avec un côté citronné, grains sur une fin boisée, légèrement épicé, le funk est modéré.

Bottle @ home. Pours with an amber colour, small diminishing white head. Aroma is quite acidic, even for a gueuze; rich in floral and fruity notes, elegant; only slight basement aromas, quite faint. Taste is medium sweet, medium sour, very well balanced, pleasant. Light body, watery texture, average carbonation.
Thuis. Zure hooiige paardestal. Sinaasappel, aardbeizuur en zachte basilicum, kruidnagel en kaneelachtige smaken volgen als je aan t zuur went. Backlog from 2015/06/30.

Bel colore dorato con riflessi rosati che influenzano anche il tono dell'esile e sfuggente schiuma. Al naso subito mela verde, uva bianca, acido lattico agrumi e paglia bagnata ; poi il calore porta su i più tipici sentori del lambic: animale, sudore. In bocca è frizzante e secca con un corpo medio-leggero. Un ottimo aperitivo da abbinare a sfiziosi stuzzichino anche fritti.

375ml Bottle. Hanssens Oude Geuze 6%
A beautiful orange gold pour with a fizzy head & a great tart nose of fruits(lemon, plum, strawberry), a bit bready (muffin like but faint) which ends in a peppery oak funk.
Full bodied and effervescent, its got a refreshing dry finish.
The taste is tart lemon, grape seed, oak, vanilla, nutty and ascerbic. Mouth puckering goodness, I can totally imagine a laborer pounding this pack on a hot sunny day. Great stuff.
Bottle; pours clear dark gold with an off white head; tart apple aroma with some yeast and spice hints; taste is tart with apples and yeast; finish is tart and dry; simple yet very nice

Bottle. Pours a cloudy orange with a quickly fading off white head. Aroma of oranges, apricots, mango, hay. Taste is of blood orange, citrus, tart. Long dry tart finish. Oily mouthfeel, medium to hard carbonation.

Pale orange, with a hint of rosé wine colour. Tiny white head that lingers only around the rim. Smooth body. Barnyard aroma, plus lemon zest and white wine vinegar. Some light malt in the taste underneath mellow sourness.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet. Aroma is sour, vinegar, citrus. Deep golden, hazy, minimal white head. Light sweetness, light bitterness, medium+ sour, taste is lemonjuice, vinegar, thin malt. Light body, soft carbonation, medium long sour aftertaste. Very sour, on the edge.

Bottled at Derat in Utrecht. Hazy deep golden, no head. Aroma is vinegar, yeast, lemon, tartness, bret. Taste is similar, maybe a bit too acidic. Slightly salty finish with rustic flavors. Medium body, medium carbonation.
Bottle. Slightly hazy pale orange. Tart grapes, vinous notes, wood. Taste is tart and sour fruits, grapes, light sweetness. Dryish finish. A bit harsher than the best ones.

Bottle at tasting. Hazy golden orange color with medium white head. Tart aroma with basement, horse blanket, wood, funk. Taste, distinct sourness, light fruit sweetness, vinous notes, wood, barnyard. Tasty.

Bottle at tasting. Hazy golden to orange colour. Aroma assertively wild and sour, basement, horse blanket. Taste incorporates basically the same flavours, horse blanket, moderate sourness, moderate tart, woody, horse blanket. Very good though somewhat rough feeling around the edges IMO.
Bottle. Pours golden color, white head. Aroma is sourish, bret. Taste is sour, bret, grapes, granny smith apples, lime.

Bottle at tpoaters gat
Pretty sour and mouthpuckering this one, a bit of a struggle to drink at first. pale golden-brown with fluffy white head. lemon, dusty, earthy, tart

Bottle, vintage 2014. Pours hazy dark yellow to orange, with a small bubbly head. Aroma is sour lactic acid, wooden brett and farmhouse notes with layers of complexity, as well as fruity notes with citrus peel. Medium body, with soft carbonation. Flavour is sour, with lactic acid, lemon peel, fabulous wooden brett with cork, cellar and farmhouse notes, as well as fruit peel and tart berries. Lingering funky bretty finish.
Bottle from saveur-biere.com. Light orange and clear color. Very thin head. Body is medium. Finish is super long and dry. Aroma is orange, citric, hop, cellar, brett, spices, pepper, wood, cheese.

Bottle at Nuetnigenough, 16th September 15. Really clean, refreshing, nice bubbles, looks good. Aroma is tart apples, sour, funk. Taste is fresh, slight sour, but in a good way, complexity as it warms. Lovely
Bottle at home. Pours hazy orange with no head.,aroma sour, green Apples, light barn. Taste is sour, tart, green Apples. Not that complex.

Sampled from a shared bottle at a beer tasting at The Cardinal, Stavanger August 2015. Clear, straw colour with a sour/sweet taste with flavours of red fruit, especially red currants and raspberries. Hints of cider vinegar, but a very mellow and well-balanced taste. Very full palate. The taste would balance very well with rich, creamy food. A great and characterful beer.
Bottle. Pours clear light copper with a thin white head. Nose is great with wet hay and dried apricots. Taste is tart with green apples and some apricot. Very good.
Bottle at BBF LAb. Orange colour with white head. Dusty, citric, fruity, tart aroma. Dusty, sour, acidic and citrc, fruity taste. Medium body.
Klar gyllen farve med tynt skum. Lukt av syrlig frukt. Smak av syrlig frukt. Fruktig syrlig og bitter nettersmak. Vinmonopolet.
Bottled 375ml. -from Beer Geek Shop Zadar, Croatia.Golden coloured, no head, heavy acidic nose. Acidic fruity, some yeast, barnyard and wood with quite dry and tart finish. Easy-drinkable brew.

UPDATED: OCT 9, 2016 37,5 cl. best before 07/08/2034, (imbottigliata il 07/08/2014?), aperta il 01/05/2016.
Dorata leggermente carica tendente allarancio, velata, schiuma bianca di media persistenza, croccante, che lascia un velo in superficie.
Aroma acidulo e leggermente lattico, mela verde, uva a bacca bianca, susina acerba, pepe, stallatico molto leggero, pelle conciata, frumento, polvere e legno umido, pungente, note di ciliegia acerba.
Al palato sempre acidula, astringente, ricorda una susina acerba, mela verde, ciliegia acerba, note legnose, frumento ben evidente, lascia una bella coda aspra di ciliegia mista a frumento e mela verde.
Retrolfatto sempre di frutta acerba.
Corpo medio, medio-leggero, ben carbonata, beverina e rinfrescante.

Fra flaske på Mi2 Cardinal aug-15: en superfrisk, kompleks og samtidig mild gueuze med massevis av citron, druer, brett (og en knivsodd salt?) og jordnære toner. Må være perfekt til søte og fete desserter, i tillegg til at den er en nytelse i seg selv. Full ganeservice.

Hanssens Oude Gueuze 15 vintage

Pours a glowing, golden color with a bubbly, immediately vanishing white head, which leaves back tiny bubbles at the edge of the glass, wrapped up by fluffy lacing.

On the nose, the beer offers well pronounced apple peel, accompanied by a distinct funkiness and old leather. Tomato bush blends into earthy, dusty malts, accompanied by even more dried garden herbs, leading to a very organcic, leafy impression, coated up by moldy funk. Tree bark becomes visible amongst this aroma profile, lending the beer additional earthiness, creating a very versatile, intriguing nose.

Has a lower carbonation with an almost biting lemon sourness, while finishing more on soft mineralic stone qualities with a very pleasant mouthfeel after the initial punch.

Begins with an aqueous note, joined by intense, but fruity, lemon, balanced by stale, dusty earth defined malts. Lemon stampedes over the tongue in an uncomprimising fashion, clashing at the back end of the palate and dissipates, while leaving back a trail of juicy lime pulp, very earthy, old rock sugar and forest earth. The taste remains focused on the multifaceted lemon, which also lends a nice dryness to the finish, softened by a mineralic aqueous note and a vinegar sourness.

Overall a very tart, fruit focussed Gueuze, while its sourness seems to evolve completely from the fruits, as it isnt overpowering any of the other flavors, but adds to their complexity, and therefore remains its natural appearance.
Shared bottle at Mi2 at Cardinal 17.08.15. Slightly hazy straw colour. Fine sour lambic aroma and taste. Complex. Very refreshing.

Lukt: Syrlige frukter.
Utseende: Fin gyllen farge.
Skum/kullsyre: Lite skum, tynn ring langs kant.
Smak: Syrlige frukter med en sur avslutning.

375ml bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy golden, small white head, leaves lacing. Aroma of apple cider vinegar, leather, apricot. Mild tart flavor, apple, yeast. No deeper flavors.

From corked/caged bottle. Pours light amber with the slightest bit of haze. Full frothy head, decent retention. Lots going on here, the nose is a wonderful combination of old musty basement, bread and apples. Flavors range from sour and tart to tangerine, peach, orange rind. Every swallow tastes a little differently. Could probably drink this all day. Wonderful brew.

Pours a clear golden with a touch of amber. Outstanding head volume and retention, world class lacing.

Nice sour nose with a bit of vinegar. Tart apples, barnyard funk and a grassy mustiness.

Light body with a lively carbonation from the middle on.

The outstanding flavor profile is very intense (sour), not very complex and quite lacking in balance. This style calls for sour and this beer delivers. It begins with a sour apple flavor that is a bit tart. The middle brings a shift towards vinegar that becomes quite noticeable in the back of the throat. The finish is sharp and dry with a lingering vinegar sourness coupled with a bit of musty funk.

Amber color, with a white, medium head. Nice tart Aroma, with some barnyard touch to it. The initial sourness fades out in a mild aftertaste, that offers a combination of fruit and cereal details. Nice gueuze.
backlog. bottle. Aroma is basement, dust, citrus, tart fruits. Dry and dusty mouthfeel, very nice gueuze.

37.5cl bottle. Almost clear copper colour with a thin white head. Barnyard, tart and fruity aroma. Average carbonation and medium body. Taste is nicely balanced with sour notes and a long dry and bitter finish. Overall, a very good gueuze.
Light amber with samll white head. Rich sour aroma. Refreshing sour taste with some touch of sweet followed by nice mild bitterness. Sour and bit bitter aftertaste.

Bottle, 37,5cl. Pours hazy, immediate lactic acid and horseblanket in the nose. Very "dirty" geuze, a true one. Lemon acid, lactic, great tartness and complexity. Barnyard funk. Finish is long and balanced. Excellent tongue twister.
Une Gueuze typée tout en puissance, avec une belle expression du Lambic, et une longue bouche acidulée. Un gueuze destinée à vieillir.

Aroma: Medium horse blanket. Light grainy. Medium acidity. ascorbic acid.
Appearance: Clear, gold body. Small off-white head. Fair retention.
Flavour: Medium sourness. Medium-light lemon. Ascorbic acid. Very dry finish with lingering lemon/sour. 
Mouthfeel: Light body. Medium-high carbonation.
Overall: Sour, but not overpowering. 

375 ml bottle, poured. Thanks Andre!
17E. Gueuze

37,5cl bottle at home. Clear copper colour, white foamy head that quickly disappears. Fruity white grapes, muscat-like together with the sweet malts, not too tard or dry; nicely balanced, rounded. Low carbonation, good body.

Bouteille 375ml. Couleur dorée translucide, mousse blanche fuyante. Arôme de levure sauvage, acidité, pomme mûre. Goût de pomme verte, levure sauvage, acidité contrôlée, touche de champignon. Carbonatation moyenne, corps moyen.
@ Havregatan 150605. Bottle (375 ml) from Systembolaget. Fruity and sour with barnyard notes, medium body with a watery to oily texture. The finish is dry and fruity with barnyard notes.

Caged and corked 750mL bottle that has a year or two of shelf age on it, pours with a gold body that has a bit of a haze to and supports a dirty white head. The aroma offers up typical Gueuze sort of soft lime, tarter notes and then thin spicy oak, a bit of soured sort of vinegar and some sweetened lime at the end of the draw. The taste is tart and near puckering with soured sweetened vinegar and lime flowing into some thin spicy oakiness. This produces pleasing depth and refreshment somehow at the same time. Solid.

37,5cl bottle. BBE 07/08/2034. 
Pours almost clear light copper/amber color with a thin white head. Aroma is inviting with dried apricots, barnyard notes, slightly acidic, tart. 
Flavor has green apples, tartness, white grapes and hint of apricots. Mouthdrying. Long finish with green apples. A very tasty gueuze.
Donkergeel van kleur en zeer zuur van smaak en geur. Weinig schuim. Doet denken aan appel cider. Misschien wel té zuur voor mijn smaak. Waarschijnlijk lekkerder op een bloedheet terras.
750ml bottle shared with jeevan. pours clear gold, thin white head. Nice sour funk aromas, light sucrose thing going on too. Dry citrus, sherbet taste. Sour finish. Nice.

Botella. @El Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo 10/05/2015 BBD:07/08/2034
Color ambar, sabores acidos, buena gueuze

Bottle from Beltramos in Menlo Park, CA. Aroma is funky fruits, citrus, strawberries, vitamin C, ammonia. Taste is citric acid, cheese and wine, rotten fruits. More of an herbal / medicinal note than I dont care for as much but still great.

Il semblerait que le lambic na pas refermenté: le liquide est acide et plat comme un cidre basque! En bouche, du jus de pamplemouuse blanc, très acide et un peu amer, quon aurait stocké dans du bois. Ce nest franchement pas bon.

(375ml bottle from Systembolaget) Pours hazed pale orange short lived active bubbles and no head. Aroma on the sour side for the style but lactic, with lemon juice and fresh cheese. Quite oaky quality that is a touch leathery, with earth and hay barnyard and an almost nutty note, funk and wood blending. A little white grape, not too fruity. On the palate, moderate lactic sourness with lemon and cottage cheese/yoghurt, white grape on the edge of vinegar. Lemon peel/wet hay hop bitterness from the middle on, some prominent must and oak. Bretty funk does build in the finish but more restrained than nose. Aftertaste is quite dry, lightly tart with the softest of bitter notes. Medium oily body with average carb. A nice lactic gueuze, but quite balanced. Not mind blowing but refreshing and very drinkable.
Bottle in the queue for CBC 2015. Hazy orange colour with a small white head. Aroma and flavour of lemon, sourness, dry, citrus, acidic and oak.

Bottle from Tanakaya. Pours an orange gold color with very little head that dissipates instantly. Aromas of apple cider vinegar, lemon zest, and hay. Light body with a slightly watery texture. Soft carbonation with a sour finish that really is bitterly sour at the end. Nice geuze for a hot summer day.

Hazy, amber, beer with almoust no head. Just a thin white layer. Nice bubbles rising to the top. 

Nose: Funk, tart notes. Apple, red berries, hay, grapefruit, stable, lemon peel, peach and apricot. Some sweetness in the nose. 
Taste: Wow! This is amazing! Sour, tart, green apples, rasperries, yeast, grass, floral, oak and spice. 
Body: Medium body with light carbonation. Very dry and bitter. Beatiful! I can feel my tounge wrickle. Very sour and refreshing. Pretty short aftertaste. 

This is a awesome, beatiful beer! Im in love :)
Cloudy orange color. Old feet in the nose. Very sour taste a bit dry and cheesy in a good way. Dry and a little old taste in the aftertaste. Very nice gueuze.

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2016 Orange color with beautiful head. Aroma of funk, hay, citrus, a bit cheesy, very Gueuze like, but not "magic" like some Gueuze are. Taste is fruity-sour, lemony, apples, hay, dry acidic finish. Carbonation is not too aggressive. A rather mellow Oude Gueuze. Not bad, but there?s better. 7-4-7-4-15 = 3.7

Nov 2015 bottle in October 2016. Very earthy, cheesy, some hints of dirty Hanssens-like vinegar in there. Nice cheesiness, nice perlage, nice earthy funk, the vinegary character is quite mellow. Lots of complexity, maybe my palate was not refined enough the first time - will have to revisit more often. Rough, dirty and complex. 8-4-9-4-17 = 4.2

Tried bottled. Colour is very pale with minimal head. Aroma is typical Gueuze, funky, sour, hay and citrus. Taste is the same. Large sour punch with a nice strong carbonation. Super refreshing on a hot day! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Intense fruity and traditional kriek aroma and sourness. Wild strawberry in the that aftertaste with red small berry and vanilla, from barrel, aroma. Red in colour.

No bottling date. Best before 07/08/2032. Pours a cloudy pale amber with small, white head. Lots of funky stable scents on the nose. Some tart berries, obvious brett, something rusty and metallic, and I'm afraid there's no other way of putting this, but it also smells a lot like a lavatory the day after you had some Tikka Masala. If you like a lot of funk, this should definetely tick all the boxes. The palate starts off with a big acidic kick in the face. Medium bodied. Bretty taste mid palate and a rather long finish with lingering acidity.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Grumlig ljus geuze! Kompost & jordig, bärig eller fylla i doft? Syrlig, sur upp i stjärten. Gröna äpplen. Väldigt fin!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, 2013 vintage. Pours light copper, fairly clear, soapy white head. Nose is a riot: turning lemon peel, iron, hay, oak. Something like peach or apricot in the flavor; not bracingly sour, very balanced. Borderline creamy mouthfeel. Outstanding.
Sour gueuzey smell. Taste is the same with a very nice sourness to it. Great lively medium carbonation that goes down very smooth.
Golden in colour with slight cream head, some fizz in the glass. Sour nose very citrussy in flavour. Lots of flavour going on, even a bit of toffee somewhere. Sharp taste at the end. Really good.

ASPETTO: biondo paglia, abbastanza torbido, dalla schiuma bianca, abbondante e persistente. AROMA: intenso e pungente, come ogni geuze che si rispetti. Agrumi, aceto, mosto di vino, formaggio con muffa (specialmente roquefort), ruggine, nonche limmancabile puzza di piedi. GUSTO: limone, limone, limone e ancora limone. Cè anche una punta di pompelmo, nonché note metalliche, come di ruggine o alluminio. Il retrogusto lascia la lingua fresca, proprio la stessa sensazione di quando si finisce di bere acqua e limone. Carbonizzazione media, corpo leggero. CONCLUSIONE: non sono unamante dello stile, ma lho voluta provare perché bere una geuze è sempre unesperienza indimenticabile. Per i miei gusti cè troppo limone, ma è comunque una birra di carattere, saporita e che disseta a dovere.

375ml bottle, peachy golden with light white film fading quickly. Slightly sour aroma offering funk, barnyard notes and some sweet fruit. Taste is very sour but surprisingly light, some funky notes and maybe some sweet sunripe fruits here as well. Mouthfeel is light but plenty sour, aftertaste has strong lasting sourness - I love it when I can feel my tongue wrinkeling. All in all good, though maybe not very complex.

April 4, 2015. Bottle, 2012 vintage. 
Hazy yellow with a medium sized frothy white head. Aroma is tart alpple skins, citrus, hay, oak, earth and light barnyard. Taste is dry acidic with lemon, apples, oak, dry finish with just a slight hint of vinegar. Light to medium bodied, nice small bubble carbonation.

Corked and caged bottle dated October 2014. Takes a bit more effort to remove the cork than some gueuzes do - carbonation is quite low. No head. Deep gold color. Very musty wood aroma along with plenty of fruity, funky, spicy notes. Something floral in there, too. Very light carbonation. More carbonation than a typical straight lambic, but not much. Taste is uniquely fruity - less lemon zest than some and more of a bright, sweet fruit sourness. Finish is perfectly dry and refreshing. Definitely a great gueuze.

Bottle @ Home. Pours slightly hazy dark yellow with a fading white head. Aroma is sourness, leather, barnyard, grapes, lemon, wet wood. Flavor is lightly sourness, barnyard, leather, sour white wine grapes, wood, dusty, lemon. Medium body, average to lively carbonation, rather dry and light acidic finish. Dry and very refreshing. Lovely. 030415

Bright copper colored beer with almost no head, light carbonation.
Smells sour.
Tastes like wood, Bretty, sour fruity and acidic.
Finish is dry.

Systembolaget, Lund flaska. Karbolsyra ladugård i aromen. Grumlig fin färg i solljus försök inte med syntetiska lampor. Dödskum. Rabarbersmak och hästskit. Inget för mass. Undrar hur den smakar om 20 år. Nåja. Will never know...
Gylden brun lett tåkete med lett tåkete hvitt skum. Sur lukt, eddik, noe vanilje og trevirke. Får litt hvitvinsfornemmelse på både lukt og smak. Sur, litt syrlig smak, bæreddik. Tørr.

Bottle. Cloudy orange pour with a 1 finger foamy that fades to a very thin ring. Great funky aroma of musty oak, lemon peel, apple, and light cheese. Taste solid. Pretty funky, lots of wet oak, some juicy lemon, light cardboard. Light to moderate sourness. Kinda tart in the finish but its not dry enough. Solid gueuze but not sure how often Ill go back.
Bottle in Florence. BB 07.08.32, yes, 2032. Wood cherry and sour, and grapes. Dry and sour all over. Only my third gueuze, but Im a fan.

The aroma is spot on, that funky, flowery smell
Pours hazy orange with almost no head at all.very fruity, sweet and sauropod wth some pepper, mmm lots of citrus.. I really like it.. Long aftertaste and a very pleasing palate oily with a nice sparkling feel.. This is almost perfect.. 
Wow

0.375 bottle. Pours a hazy golden barely producing a small white top. Nice aroma of stables, dry hay and a semi tart pungency. Taste is mellow sour with hints of pale malts. Fairly low co2 leves compared to other gueuzes Ive had. Still a nice lambic.
@ Havregatan 21/3-15. Bottle from Systembolaget. Fruity, bretty and acidic with notes of grape. Body is medium, the finish is dry, fruity and bretty with acidic notes.

sample from 37,5cl bottle. poured a deep golden colour with a white fluffy head. citrus, vinegar, crisp, some malts, hay, murky hops? tart, nice mouthfeel, dry tart aftertaste, bang for your buck geuze

Oude Gueuze z Hanssens Artisanaal, co? wspania?ego, fantastyczne.Wygl?da?o pysznie. Piana nieznaczna, niewielka, zapach s?odki, czerwona porzeczka z podbiciem malinowym.Je?li za? chodzi o doznania smakowe, to naprawd? sama przyjemno??: Geuze do?? dobrze nasycone, wyczuwalna czerwona porzeczka,malina, agrest, nieznacznie s?odkie, cierpkie, wytrawne ale pyszne. Podsumowuj?c: Hanssens Oude Gueuze jest bardzo, bardzo dobre,wiem, ?e s? lepsze, ale to niema znaczenia, to jest pyszne. Polecam

Acidic, sour, funky yeastiness, really tart and lovely.
Golden colour, no head. Acidic, but not that tart for the style, mid-sweet and fruity, refined, but understated.
Medium body, soft carbonation, tart finish.
Enjoyable, but wouldve liked more acidity.
Bottle. Pours hazy orange with a creamy white head. Aroma is acidic and woody. Taste is acidic with a fruity, citric style. Very dry and refreshing.

Bottle @ home. Pours a ahzy orange liquid with a fizzy short lived head. Aroma is nicely balanced with funk and brett, red apples, mango, lemon, hay, oak, vanilla. Moderately sour but smooth taste with great durability. Flavors of mango, grape, red apples, lemon zest, hay, brett and oak. Acidic and lemon sour finish at medium level. Lingering brett, vanilla and mango in aftertaste. Really nice balance overall.

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Pours hazy golden with a frothy white head. Funky aroma with sour citrus. Extremely tart and sour to begin with. Lemon juice flavours with musty notes. Extremely refreshing with a dry finish. Very good indeed.
38cl. bottle (375ml.) in Ghent, on the barge Kaffee De Planck. Only discovered this brew recently. A smooth lambic blend, for gueuze lovers. Less sour than expected.

Bottle consumed at home since all of my group has rated this. Pours a cloudy orange golden color with a medium sized white head. The aroma has nice funky Brett, barnyard character, oak, hay, citrus and some acetic character. The flavor has sour grapefruit and lemon citrus, quite a bit of sourness to this upon the first taste, acidic, dry with mild fruit sweetness. Interesting gueuze that combines nice tart fruit character and classic gueuze sourness.
2012 Pours yellow with a white head. Smells of sweat, funky, peachy, tarte, acidic. Taste is on the mellow side with some funky bites and a lemony finish.

Poured into a teku showing a deep caramel honey color with a good carbonation. 

Exploding with very strong aromas of brett with strong background aromas of barnyard manure and hay. 

The palate is full bodied with very light carbonation. Light to moderate tartness with the same flavors of brett and barnyard manure/hay. The finish shows a very large, sudden, but short burst of fresh apricot fruit. Strange but still fun drink.
Bottle at Brugs Bierfestival. Not too cheesy, not too much acid, nice sour, very good Gueuze, one of the better regulars.
375 ml bottle. Pours a hazy copper color with light head. Aromas of barnyard and citrus. Flavors of sour peach candies, other stoned fruit, and tart wheat. Smells awful, tastes great.
Helder geel bier met weinig schuim. Smaak is zuur en droog met verrassend sporen van kaas en zuur fruit, tevens iets van rook.

Bottle. Golden with little white head. Aroma is quite cheesy, funky, sharp. Taste is earthy, funky, cheesy, sharp. Very sour
 Tasty
Excellent! not too strong sour fruity taste and a little sweetness in the aftertaste.

Bottle shared at Sub Zero 
Hazy amber with a small off-white head, some lacing. Aroma is tart and fruity. Taste is fruity up front then tart with a dry finish 
Well balanced and easy to drink.
Quite easy on the nose. Taste is very good! Very well balanced, not to tart. Light carbo. One of the best geuze I've had!

Color cobrizo limpio, brillante y uniforme con espuma blanca ligera. Aroma mohoso del brett equilibrado con un intensa sensación ácida de manzana verde. Cuerpo medio, intenso sabor ácido y afrutado, y sensación fresca como de mananza y ciruela verde que se equilibra con una sensación final seca moderada. El resgusto es largo y afrutado.

375ml bottle (10/13 bottling) pours semi clear dark amber with a finger of head. Nose is big funky toasty oak, bretty, orange and citrus, some light stonefruit, dusty attic, some acetic notes. Taste is tart, nice acidity level, funk-forward with sweet apricot, tangerine, green apple, and dried orange notes, backed by toasted wood and dusty grain, big skunky hay notes. Finish is tart funk with some dry attic wood funk and light sweetness of dried apricot and old citrus. Solid but on the sweeter side and the nose was a bit acetic.  Not the best shelf gueze.

It pours a golden color with a pillow head. It has a sour aroma with fruits mixed in. It has a sour taste combined with being tart that has a pucker factor in addition to flavors. There are fruit flavors with moderate carbonation. It has an extra sour kick on the palate.
Bue en bouteille. Pas mon style de bière à la base. Je lai trouvée courte en bouche, avec une acidité modérée.

Bue en bouteille de 37.5cl à Molenhof Restaurant & Bar Oud Postje, couleur blonde/ambrée, petite mousse, grosse effervescence, une attaque acide citronnée en début de bouche et belle continuitée sur le bois jeune et son acidité.

Nice orange color, a little hazy, with almost no head. Smell is citrus, tart, acetic, and a lot of wood notes, tannine. Taste is tart, but not so sour as I expected from one of the real Gueuze makers. Full mouthfeel, good carbonation.
Really good!
Very sour geuze. Taste like lemon juice. No sweetness or bitterness at all.
Pours golden clear with some lacings. Nose has green apples, funk and some lemon. Taste has some light acid, some bready sweetness and some lemon.

375 ml bottle into tulip glass, bottled in 10/2013. Pours slightly hazy deep golden color with a 2 finger dense off white head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Light spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of huge sour lemon, lime, green apple, white grape, white vinegar, hay, straw, grass, oak, leather, pepper, musty funk, wheat, and oak/yeast earthiness. Fantastic aromas with great balance and complexity of fruity/funky/acidic yeast, oak, and pale malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big sour lemon, lime, green apple, white grape, white vinegar, hay, straw, grass, oak, leather, pepper, musty funk, wheat, and oak/yeast earthiness. Moderate amount of fruity/earthy tartness on the finish; with lingering notes of lemon, lime, green apple, white grape, vinegar, hay, straw, grass, oak, leather, pepper, musty funk, wheat, and oak/yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Fantastic complexity and balance of fruity/funky/acidic yeast, oak, and pale malt flavors; with a great sweetness/tartness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, crisp, and moderately acidic mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an outstanding gueuze style! All around awesome complexity and balance of fruity/funky/acidic yeast, oak, and pale malt flavors; and very smooth and crisp to drink with the balanced acidity. A highly enjoyable offering.

(Hanssens Oude Gueuze) Bottle 375 ml, corked and caged, served into a tulip. ABV 6%
Clear body with a bright golden orange colour on it and a small white head sitting on top, low retention, light lacing left behind.
Aroma of cork, old wood, barnyard, grapes, apple peels.
Fruity taste, apples, grapes, light sourness, light perfume, old wood.
Medium thin body, soft carbonation, nicely tart on the palate.
Very good.
Aroma of citrus and apples, taste is apples, sour, tart, very nice palate, very crisp.

Complex aroma of tart apple, tart fruits, citrus, barnyard funk, earthy notes, oak. Flavour is heavy sour with a nicely dry finish. Scores major points in both the sourness and funk department. An excellent Gueuze.

Golden. Minimal foam, little hazy, funky and acidic aroma, high sourness. Very lightly sweet. Light body. Crisp, long dry and sour finish.
Overall: Refreshing, very sour. Good-- rated with beerbasher
Bottle at Waterhuis Gent. Clear dark gold with white head. baby bsrf, lactic aroma. Tastes sour and leaves acidic sensation down the throat. Medium body.

Bottle to tulip glass. Pours a hazy yellow with a white head that dissipates quickly. Nose of tart fruit and barnyard scents. Flavor is extremely acidic, and a lot of the same fruit flavors. Admittedly, this is my first lambic, and I thought it would be sweeter. This is very sour.

375ml bottle from Premier Gourmet in Buffalo, New York. Clear golden orange in colour with a thin dissipating white head, some light lacing. The aroma is very sour and tart, lots of green grapes, apple skins, acidic, some wood, grapefruit. The flavour is very sour, insanely tart, highly acidic, lots of citrus - grapefruit, lemons, apples and wood. Acidic mouthfeel, medium/light body, high carbonation. Finishes very long, acidic, sour. Holy shit, this is one sour gueuze. So tart and in your face. Very intense stuff here, not your everyday gueuze thats for sure.
Pours a light translucent gold with no head. Aroma of very acidic vinegar, funk and oak. Taste is very acidic, dry, hay, earthy notes and funk. A bit too acidic for me
Bottiglia 75 CL anno 2013, colore giallo miele con una schiuma fine e poco persistente, una delle birre più sour che ho provato fino ad ora, tuttavia ben bilanciata e piacevolissima da bere

First acid rush in the nose short lived. Really strong acid feeling in the throat not unlike a failed vomit attempt. Not bad but definitely too sour for most people. Not sure i could drink up the bottle.

Geuze extrêmement acide. Il est difficile de finir le verre. Bière plate directement. Pas la meilleure représentante de la famille des geuzes. Étrangement, si on la bois directement ( sans la faire rouler dans la bouche ) elle devient bcp moins acide

75cl bottle at home Vintage 2010. Sharp, spritzy, lemon acidity in the taste. The appearance is typical gueuze but the head dissipates rapidly due to the sourness of this gueuze. Typical Hanssens profile. Funky but very citric and sharp. This would hold up well for aging.

Pours clear. Pale in color, nice white head. Aroma is very clear, with some slight acidic notes. Taste is definitely sour, refreshing, and again: very clear, no off-flavours. Fantastic, old-style gueuze.

330ml corked bottle served in a flute glass.
A: Poursva yellow to orange golden color. Clear. Forms a medium fizzy and small bubbled white yo yellow head. Medium to low retention and only few lacings left in the glass
S: Very fruity and tart in the nose. Apple cider, sweet grains and Lambic yeasts, mainly. Some notes of oak
T: Slightly sweet grains upfront. Very fruity with strong notes of apples. Vinegar. Strong notes of oak. Slightly metallic. Strong earthy notes of Lambic yeasts
M: Light body. High carbonation. Tart and fruity aftertaste
O: Easydrinking beer. Great Gueuze specimen. Recommended
[ BA Review @ 2/12/2013 ]
Fles gedeeld met bryanvdv, amber, troebel met een witte kraag. Smaak en geur mooi zuur, appel, citroen onrijpe druiven. maar ook kruidigheid kaneel en brood. Body is vol.

Bottle. Golden body with no appearant head. Aroma of green apple, grapes, flowers, cinnamon. Taste is tart and sour, apples, sharp citric, berries, dry and sour finish, lasting like forever. Nice beer!

Flasche (75 cl) vom Hopduvel, Gent, anderthalb Jahre im Keller gelagert. - Orangegelb, trüb; grobporiger Schaum. - In der Nase die typische, leicht kellerig-modrige und scharf säuerliche Gueuze-Note, wie trockener Apfelwein mit einem Hauch Pferdemist. - Antrunk krachtrocken sauer mit bitterer Grapefruit, Zitronenschale und der muffigen Pferdedeckennote. Durchschnittlich rezent, schlank, beinahe schmerzhaft trocken im Mund. Im Abgang extrem muffig herb, holzig trocken und immer noch so sauer, daß es einen schüttelt. - Fast ungenießbar, wüßte man nicht, daß es sich hier um eine berühmte Gueuze handelt - und wer wollte sich da schon als Banause outen? Andere hier bewerten diese Gueuze als nicht zu aufdringlich-sauer, aber ich fand sie noch extremer, saurer und holziger als alle bisher verkosteten. Zweifellos ein außerordentliches Bier, aber auch extrem gewöhnungsbedürftig.

Ein feines Geuze, das die gewöhnlichen Aromen durchaus anbietet und mit etwas Getreide und Hefe nur so spielt. Angenehm ist die milde Säure, die hier wirklich moderat eingesetzt wird. Jedoch sind die Aromen nicht bis zum letzten durchgepeitscht, daher Qualität und Liebe ja, grandiose Klasse nein.
Smells like champagne and oak. Really sour and dry. Not my style. Gueuze is ok, but this is too much for me...

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2015 Bottle at home. Pours hazy dark golden with medium big, off-white head. Aroma of sour fruits, grapes, lemongrass, roasted hazelnut, horse stable, burned rubber, glue. Very sour and tart taste, salty, rubber. Quite special gueuze and very nice.

0.75 ml bottle from Bierzwerg. The Lambic pours out in a hazy brownish colour with low head and medium body. Aroma of mild vinegar and unripe berries. Taste of mild vinegar, mild acid, unripe nuts, unripe berries and light bread. Breadish finish. Wonderful quaffable and a right enjoyment to drink.

Bottle split with Mike and Taylor. Aroma is tart lemon, barnyard funk, light stilton cheese, and white wine. Pours bubbly and blonde with lots of fizz and a quick fizzy soda head. Taste is tart starfruit, lemon, and white wine with a barnyard funk throughout. Wonderfully intense and complex. Took this one for granted and it wowed me. Will gladly have this again.

Barwa: złota, początkowo krystaliczna, po dolaniu dolnej części wyraźnie zmętniona. Piana biała, drobno pęcherzykowa, niewielka, bardzo szybko opadająca i pozostająca jedynie przy ściankach. 

Aromat: początkowo atakuje dość nieprzyjemna nuta siarkowa, która na szczęście (w przeważającej części) dość szybko się ulatnia. Oprócz tego istna mieszanka wybuchowa, a zatem nuty kwaśne, owocowe (m.in. morele), przysłowiowa końska derka, słód (herbatniki), a nawet nieco rozpuszczalnika. 

Smak: od początku kwaśny, cierpki, owocowy, niczym cytryny, ale także dość wytrawny. Dopiero na końcu lekko słodka nuta. 

Hanssens Artisanaal nie warzy własnych piw tylko zajmuje się mieszaniem różnych lambików, w różnym wieku. Kupuje brzeczkę od uznanych producentów m.in. (Cantillon czy Lindemans), po czym leżakują one od kilku miesięcy do 3 lat. Oude Gueuze to zwykle mieszanka 2 i 3 letnich piw. Dodatkowo są one przechowywane w beczkach liczących sobie nawet 100 lat. Być może dlatego ten trunek trafił do przytaczanej wielokrotnie książki. Barwa jest adekwatna, smak dość intensywny, jedynie aromat zawiera oprócz typowych, także nieco nieprzyjemnych nut. Raczej dla pasjonatów.
Out of a bottle in Brugge. Beautiful fruit and sour up front. Hazy gold with no head as expected. Taste is tart and fruity. Crisp, dry finish.

Bottle 0.375l. Pours almost clear golden with white head. Aroma is tart, funk, white wine, lemon. Taste is light sweet, light bitter, heavy sour, some lemon, apples, white wine. Aftertaste is acidic, slightly sharp, subtle bitterness. Excellent. Sour but with so much flavour in the background.

Bottle poured into a brandy snifter. Pours a clear gold with a small white head of foam. The aroma is funky grass and a touch of skunk. The taste is dry, tart green apple. Medium body with medium carbonation. An alright gueuze.

UPDATED: OCT 20, 2014 Fully traditional geuze made from wort by, I believe, Lindemans and Girardin which Hanssens has spontaneously fermented at their own premises. Orange blonde colour, spritzy body like any good old geuze should have, off-white, stable head, very funky aroma, horseblanket, lemon peel, hay, old sherry, sweat, sulphuric accents, barnyard taste, sour in a well-balanced way, very funky, dry acid finish. Clearly a geuze with its own character.
Een heel lekkere geuze, een van de beste dat ik ooit geprobeerd heb. Een aanrader

Amber beer with a small but stable white head. Very nice complex aroma, sour but still mild lambic. Full body, very complex sour, but mild, flavour. Nice balanced gueze. Very nice beer. (Corked Bottle 75cl)

Citrus, stale almost musty aroma. Pours with a thin white head, which soon disappears. Despite this, the carbonation is fairly lively. Yellow-orange in colour. Taste is amazing: initially sharp and acidic, citrus fruit with a little balance of wine-gum sweetness. The mustiness is also there. Lively on the palate after the initial spasm of your tastebuds with a nice well-balanced mouthfeel.
Overall, an uncompromising gueuze but a real stunner. Great.

Tasted in long stemmed tulip glass. Keeping it honest, this is my first lambic to taste. Color is light amber, with very light body and medium high carbonation, the very light body makes the head almost instantaneously vanish.
Aroma is wonderful, hints of winey character with lemony, maybe ginger notes, you can smell some funk but its tamed. Taste is sour and acidic, refreshing, gratifying, complex. Ive read that lambics tend to smell like...barns but this one does not particulary. Reminds me of some champagne i drank a while ago. Not the kind of beer that i love or that i would drink everyday but this is indeed a wonderful beer worthy of respect.
Bottle from hopduvel in Ghent. Nose is funk, bitter, mushrooms and lemon. High carbonation. Lots of citrus fruits. Good sour notes. Lingering funky taste. Brilliant!
Bottle. Pours a beautiful golden clear with some lacings. Nose has green apples, funk and some lemon. Taste has some light acid, some bready sweetness and some lemon.

Aroma of white wine, lemon, tart, horse blanket, bubble gum. Appears darker gold light fluffy white ring, spotty lacing. Taste is tart, sour lemon lime. Nice sour, velvety mouthfeel. This seems like my favorite Oude gueuze...

Kaatuu lasiin kullankeltaisena ja kirkkaana, katoava vaahto on noin sormen paksuinen ja oluessa näyttäisi olevan paljon hiilihappoja. Tuoksua hallitsee nahkaisuus ja hapokas omenaisuus, mutta siinä on myös makeampaa rypäleisyyttä ja jopa banaania. Maussa jatkuu hapokkaan omenaisuuden jyräys, jota kuitenkin melko hyvin tukee makeampi rypäleisyys ja makea hedelmäisyys. Nahkaisuutta on, mutta huomattavasti vähemmän kuin tuoksussa. Suutuntuma on alkuun makea kuivuen melko nopeasti, hiilihappoisuuden ollessa melko runsasta. Todella hyvä kombo, samalla makea ja kuiva, täyteläinen ja raikas. Hanssensin oude geuze on tavallaan makeamman puoleinen lambic ollen samalla kuitenkin hyvin kuiva. Omenaisuus ja rypäleisyys on vahvimpana läsnä ja yleisfiilis on kuin tuunattu valkoviini. Loistava suutuntuma.

(bottle - corked & caged 750 ml) Cloudy gold pour with a fluffy white head. Sour tart funky aroma. Very acidic. Lightly sweet for a brief second and then explodes in a sour bomb with an acidic aftertaste.

Bottle. Clear copper with a medium/large frothy white head. Dusty, flowers, yellow apples, white grapes, peach, lime, wood and a good deal of horse staple along with some band aid and leather. Medium body, oily texture, medium carbonation, medium sweet and sour. Mellow but long lasting sweet/sour finish. Drinkable with changing flavours and good balance. Good stuff, want more.

A little bit more lemon peel than with your traditional gueuze, especially in the finish. Pale yellow orange with a small foam top that quickly disappears. Muscat wine in the nose, mixed with the more traditional earthy smell, a bit skunky even. Not sweet and sour, but more bitter and sour. Nice beer.

UPDATED: JAN 15, 2015 Flaska 75 cl troligen 4 år (bf 2030). Ruggigt väder i stugan. Delar med Bengan och Isabel. Doften påminner om cantillons bryggeri. (Aldrig besökt Hanssen ännu). Funk, svag ättika, lite spannmål, ost och grapefrukt. Smaken är oerhört balanserad och härlig även om första klunken var skarp i syran. Angenäm ostlig beska. Underskattad bärs. Bara att köpa mer av!!!

Rerate: samma poäng. Tung härlig funkbas som hänger i ett bra tag. Tydlig syra och väldigt torr men ingen magsaft etter ättika. Drar parallellt mot De Cam och den här är mer komplex och smaken hänger i länge.

375 ml bottle shared by Dana. Thanks man! Pours a hazy and light orange color with an inch of white head that fades to a ring of bubbles on the glass. Aroma is classic gueuze: funk, straw, farmyard, light citrus. Flavor is pleasant, with a subtle biting sharpness in the finish.
Det här var smaskens, ölen hade en okej kropp men en fin balans. Smaken bar toner av granny smith äpple och citrus med en tjusig tillhörande syra.

Pour hazy light orange, with a small n slightly creamy white head.
