Aroma has slight funk, plenty of citrus, green apples, slight barnyard. The taste is pretty darn sour, but has some nice fruity sweetness to it as well. Medium bodied, with a lively carbonation. Pretty darn refreshing and thirst cleansing. Thanks a bunch to Hoprider for sharing.

Bottle dated January 2013. Poured into a snifter. Champagne gold with fizzy white head and effervescents. Tart apples and Brett funkiness on the nose. Crisp fresh sour fruit, tart dry finish... Excellent Gueuze!

This underdog of a gueuze is a winner! I pours hazy golden orange with a white fizzy head. The aromas are very inviting. Loads of citrus and sour apple peelings. Good amounts of funky brett on the nose too along with clear yoghurty notes. The mouthfeel is light initially, gets oily and somewhat creamy. The taste is mouthwateringly fresh and sour. Again with lemons, tart juices, yoghurt and zesty brett flavours. Aftertaste is clean and morish.. Near perfect gueuze! (rating no. 100!)

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2016 Bottled. Pours clear golden with a large, white head. Aroma of wood, green apples, barnyard, brett and citrus. Slightly sweet flavor that ends up dry and tart. Medium bodied, watery to oily texture and average to lively carbonation. A very nice  and crisp Oude Geuze. 🌟🌟🌟🌟
Very nice lambic with complex character of oak, sour notes, almond, wild fruits, citrus. Uau

Bottle from Whole Foods. Pours translucent orange with a small white head that dissipates rather quickly. The aroma has a bit of vinegar notes, a bit of woodiness / earthiness, a bit of washrag. The taste is quite tart, longer sourish duration, semi-dry. Very solid.

U: disig gyllorange två fingrar smutsvitt bubbligt skum knappt någr rester 4
D: sur och rejält funkig med blöt hund urinoar citron bokna äpplen vinäger men tyvärr också nagellack. 
S: sur och torr med citron äpple lite krusbär vinäger och en lätt ljust brödig ton. Mot slutet känns den plötsligt lite stickig och lite kemisk. Men inte så illa som doften. 
M: medel till lättare med mjukt frasig/poppig kolsyra och lite oljig sträv textur. 
T: det började riktigt bra men så hände något framförallt med doften som inte kändes bra. Går inte ens att lukta på. Bad bottle.
Geel oranje koper kleurig bier( in lagen) geen schuimkraag , wit randje. Smaak fris zurige appelschil( Granny Smit) en een menthol nasmaak. Heerlijk geuze bier. Gedronken met Bryan

Fles gedeeld met lachneger. Goud koperkleurig licht troebel geen kraag. Aroma is fris zuur, appel. Smaak is zuur met lekkere afdronk. Tikje wrang, iets droog. Mooie geueze.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma is everywhere in the room, strong. Sour green apples for me. Taste is a snap of sour you really have to get used to. Likewise aftertaste, but I like it. (Brussel 201405)
Golden with a white head - Good sour aroma - Good sour body with some citrus / lemons - Sourness goes into a long finiah - This was good

Bottle, from Triangle Wine Morrisville. Good aroma. barnyard, basement aromas, grape, lemon, acrid. 1st pour clean yellow gold color, ok head that disappeared quickly, no lace. medium sourness, light sweetness in flavor. medium body, creamy mouthfeel, bitter, long finish, nice stuff. Flavor and finish my favorite parts. Finish just goes on and on.
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: Bottle to glass. Pours a hazy deep golden light amber color with virtually no head. Aroma is dry, slightly tart, fruity, apples. Flavor is mostly tart, slightly sweet, grapes, apples. Lighter in body with a lingering tartness, not much carbonation. Very tasty sour beer.

750 mL bottle from Premier Gourmet in Buffalo, served in a stem glass. Pours hazy orange-amber with a small white head that fades to a thin remnant and leaves a small amount of fine lace. The nose has big notes of sour apples, cider, flowers and yeast. The flavour is intensely sour with big apple cider notes, pale malts, yeast and flowers. The finish is long and cidery with yeasty notes. On the palate it is medium in body with an astringent texture and soft carbonation. Overall, a decent but intensely sour geuze with apple and cider notes. Not as complex as it could be. 2014-05-02

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2015 Bottle, 37.5 cL. Home. A beautiful orange beer with brown hues, yellow at the bottom of the glass. Fizzy. Medium foamy white head ; good retention. Smoked aroma with wood, vinegar and apple (when the temperature is getting higher). Medium to heavy sour  and medium sweet. Medium body and silky texture. Average carbonation. Lasting sour>sweet finish. Refreshing. Overall, de-li-cious !!! I really liked this one ; even texture is great ; carbonation not too fizzy.
Bottle thanks to mora...Pour is golden with a thin bubbly head..Nose is nice funk, dry, barrel, ...Taste is some sweetness, berries, nice soft tartness..

Bottled January 2013. Clear orange pour with a white head. The aroma has some cheesy funk as well as some barnyard notes and biscuit malt. The flavor is not as funky as the aroma led me to believe it would be, but it is still very nice. I get some cherry notes as well as some light barnyard funk, a little bit of brett and some light tartness. Medium mouthfeel and low carbonation. Very nice gueuze.

This pours a cloudy, golden amber color with a foamy head. The aroma is slightly sweet and yeasty. The taste is sweet with lots of sugar, slightly tart, and leaves a lingering bitter taste. This is very tasty and a decent lambic for the price. With a good full texture this a lambic that delivers.
I thought I was buying an unblended Lambic, but unfortunately it was another Gueze. Nothing good about this style.

Pours lovely, slight cloudy orange with a white, lively head. Aroma is fresh and sour, with classic geuze and vinegar notes. The taste is very grape fruity, but has an almost strong sourness to it, that tickles your tongue. A little cheese in the end, that you some times get in old saisons. Very nice geuze, but very standard too.

Pours cloudy amber with a tiny white head. Aroma is fresh and tart. I get notes of green sour apples, freshly squeezed lemon, sour berries, subtle stable notes, wild Brett quality overall. Taste has that same green sour apples along with tons of grapefruit, sour berries, citrus and wild Brett notes overall. Almost has notes of sulfur in it. Also some cheesy notes in the end. Wow - what a surprise this was!

Bottle aged 1 year. Clear golden amber color, nice big head, lemon and a little earthyness behind it. After a couple sips the aroma seems closer to strawberry lemonade that is almost immediately overshadowed once the sour and mulch flavors take over. I only know cause I just walked into my wifes garden and her manure mulch is spot on. This beer is very nice for a warm day in the garden. Cheers

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2015 Flaska från systembolaget. Guldfärgad smått grumlig vätska med vitt skum. Fräsch syrlig doft av framförallt citron. 
I smaken återkommer känslan av färsk och sur citron. Jordkällare, te och äpplekart. Syrligheten balanseras upp av en bra beska.

2012 vintage. Cold bottle, into a tulip. Perfectly clear orange, slightly sparkling, small white head. Aroma - funky lemon. Body - medium, low carbonation for the style (medium-ish), slightly foamy, tooth-coating sugar. Taste - sodawater, sour lemon, finishes tart, some undercooked chicken. Overall - not my favourite style, but a decent example.

Aroma: Hay, Apricot, Mildly Acidic

Appearance: Hazy Amber/Golden Straw Hue, Passes Some Light, White Head Ring, Some Lacing

Taste: Hay, Apricots, Mild Cranberry, Mild Lactic Acid

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Semi Dry, Mildly Bitter
Lätt dimmig och ljus gul med för stilen ett förvånande litet vitt skum. Doft: Funk, halm, syrlig malt doft, honung. Smak: Funk, halm, körsbärs kärnor, svart te med smak rik honung, grape.

Bottle, 13C. Gold with a white head that lasts awhile. Aroma of Moroccan lemons, damp hay, washed rind/ forest floor, apricots and their stones, both mellow and tart apples. Lively carbonation slightly masks slippery texture. Fruity - apples, Moroccan lemons (including their brine), apricots, with hay - zingy brett notes, moderate forest floor earthy funk, fairly dry and woody finish. Long finish is sour and zingy with hints of mellow sweet apples also lingering. Seemed straightforward at first, but revealed more after a while - that curious lingering fruitiness helped keep it quaffable too.

Bottle. Pours a hazy orange-tan color with a very small white head on it. Nose seems to be rather sour and fruity, with some light citrus in there and a bit of sweet figs popping through. Taste is very dry and quite sour, with some nice citrus tones. Its got a bit of a bite to it, but stays pretty smooth. Nice gueuze.
Sample from bottle at RBNAG 2014, Halden, Grand Tasting. Golden colour. Lovely brett aroma, lemony and farmhouse notes. Even better sour flavour with loads of brett and lemony notes.
15.02.2014. 0,75l Bottle. RBNG-14. Hazy golden yellow colour with white head. Sour malty aromas. Very fresh and rich beer. Lots of flavours. Berries.
Bottle. Hazy deep golden color with a thin head. Aroma of apricot, apple and sour yeast. Sour, acidic, bitter taste with some initial sweetness.-- via beerbasher/winphone

Yellow, orange brew with a long lasting white head. Smells of citrus, apple, typical Geuze smell. A refreshing geuze with high carbonation. Nice sour and lemon notes, very smooth. Getting some apple, green tea, however, the sour lemon taste triumphs. This is a great beer.

Pours nicely golden with high white head
Aromas of sour yeast, citrus, apricot, hints of bread
Nicely balanced sour with good sweetness. Has notes of citrus, honey, lemon grass, bread

375ml green corked and caked bottle, poured into a tulip glass. Appearance is cloudy orange with a small sized white head, that reduced quickly leaving no lacing. Aroma of lemon peels, overripe apples, table grapes and barnyard. Flavours of lemon peels, green apples, table grapes, wheat bread and wooden notes. Taste is light sweet, medium bitter and medium sour. Palate is medium-light bodied, smooth texture and lively carbonation. A great beer for the style, crisp and not overly dry or sour.
Bottle @ Tröls. High in acidity, with loads of citrus, lime and green apples and a bunch of malty/yeasty aromas as well like hay, wheat and stables.

Deep yellow orange with thick slowly fading head. Nose of light funk, wheat, preserved lemon. Clean, tart lemon citrus finish. Full bodied. Tasty, but not the most complex of the standard bearers. Worked great as an aperitif to some pork schnitzel.
Väldigt fruktg och druvig i smak och arom. Kanske lite pepprig i smaken också.

From a shared bottle at RBNG-14. Pours slightly hazy orange with a minimal head. Sour and funky with lovely yeasty notes. Niceand refreshingly sour. Delicious stuff! (2014-02-15 - Grand Tasting, Fredriksten festning, Halden)

Bottle shared at a sour tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Pours yellow with a small head, aroma of sulfur, honey, olives, flowers, wood, freshness, flavor is sour with pleasant sweetness, plum juice, green tea, fresh, medium bodied

Pours clear amber with fairly low white head and a good amount of co2 bubbles. Aroma of tart, peach, green grapes, apples, fresh grass and of course bretta. Taste is tart and apples, but not overly sour. Light, crisp body with average carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

un bellissimo colore oro antico. schiuma presente sofficie a grana media. il prf
ofumo è quello della campagna, di cantina unito alla frutta matura. il sapore acido e citrico. leggermente astringente

UPDATED: APR 27, 2014 21.04.2013, 0,375l bottle shared with ClubGonzo & ej @ Bezoekerscentrum De Lambiek:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly fresh sour-ish, citrus peel, soda powder, oak, sorrel, sour socks, mild vinegar, lemon, hay. Taste is dry acidic sour, lemon, citrus peel, sorrel, raw rhubarb, mild vinegar, grass, oak, sour socks, soda powder. Medium bitterness, dry acidic mouthfeel. Nice.
Shared bottle at RBNG-14. Pours hazy golden, no head. Aroma is moderate sweet/citric. Same goes for the taste, sour, earthy, dry and woody. Funky fresh allover. Nice

37.5 cL bottle at home. Pours almost clear golden with a large white head. Interesting aroma with a little bit of barn, some malts, some sweet fruity notes, wood and tartness. Taste is quite citrussy with some barnyard and a long over medium sour finish. Quite dry. Medium body and carbo. Better than I remembered it to be.

Bottle 375ml - Hazy yellow orange beer with a small, virtually none, off-white head. Aroma is woody with notes of acidic wood, grapefruit and yeast. Flavor is acidic and sour with notes of wood, citrus and red berries. Body is light to medium, texture is watery, carbonation is flat. Good but not great.
Très bonne gueuze, légère odeur de souffre très acide en bouche. Lacidité assèche et redonne envie den boire une, allez zou ;)

275 ml bottle. Lightly hazy golden with white head. Aroma sour, ammonia, solvent, malt, horse blanket and apple must. Taste is sour, light, ammonia, apple must, wood with a sour and a bit astringent finish

In tasting glass. An amber with haze. Foamy head, white. Aroma is, well if you smelled something like this in your fridge you would toss it in the trash. The smell is sour fruit. The taste is sour lemon and I get grass. Mouth feel is thin and slick. The finish is a lemon yeast. Interesting enough to buy a bottle to bring home.

Pours light amber with an excellent head. 
Aroma: just awful but with encouragement I took a sip.
Flavor: way better than the aroma, it is markedly tart -- sour enough to alter the mouthfeel. Complex and hard to describe
Fine soft carbonation
O: an awful smelling ale with a fascinating flavor.

One of the best I have had can drink year round. Pour is amber with a cloudy haze that floats in the glass. Small white head that sticks to your glass. Aroma is malty and sour. Full of fruit flavors like lemon,lime and grapefruit. Not over sour but if you dont like sour maybe a little much.

Sampled at a beer class at the Holy Grale in Louisvile. 

Slightly cloudy, honey colored pour. Lacy white head. 

Highly carbonated, tingly mouthfeel. 

Sour, tart nose. Lemongrass. A little hint of barnyard, but not overly funky. Mouthwatering. 

Tart, lemony citrus taste. No hop character. Very complex blend of flavors. The tartness doesnt overpower, rather it complements the citrusy, refreshing flavor of the beer. 

A wonderful example of one of my favorite styles. Absolutely delicious.

Appearance: Orange golden, hazy. Some off-white head. Citrus.
Aroma: Fruit, tartness. Citrus.
Taste: Pretty tart, quite a lot of fruit.
Info: 750ml bottle, 24/12-2013, 55/100, BB: 7/8-2030

Bottle. Golden with fluffy white head. Aroma is apples, citrus, lemon. 
Fruity taste with lots of sourness. Medium body, lots of carbonation, dry finish.

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2017 0,7 cl (bottle shared.)
Appearance: a slightly cloudy yellow, small white head
Aroma: yeast, sour apples, vinegar,brett-funk and a hint of citrus.
Taste: Very Tart but fruity which finishes dry with in the background some wooden notes. It does need to warm up, to cold and you only have the tartness. 
medium body, medium to High Carbonation

Oranje amber helder met minimale witte kraag. Het aroma is zoals te verwachten zurig met de daardoorheen komende karakteristieken van eikenhout. Smaken zijn matig zoet, licht bittertje, zoals te verwachten zwaar zuur, stevig, matig fruitig, citrus en appels. Limoen, cotrus. Medium body, glad van textuur, lage co2, afdronk wrang/zuur. T is iig mooi complex van diverse zuurgraden, houttoets, glad in de mond

bottle from beergium.com cloudy yellow, small bubbly head.Aroma is tart and sour,has notes of vinegar, funk,, leather, glue. aroma appears pretty strong and sharp. Flavor is tart, vinegar, sweet fruity note, The beer is both very very sour and wild yeasty, and somewhat sweet at the same time, perhaps adjusted with sugar? Perhaps just a coincidence.

Golden colour with a white head that quickly dissappears. Aroma has notes of citrus, slightly green apple and yeast. Flavor is very acidic with strong fruity notes, some wooden notes. The final is mild acidic, very easy to drink, fruity ans really refreshing.

MHD 07/08/2027 
Dunkelgolden im Glas, feiner weißer Schaum. 
Der Geruch ist angenehm mild-sauer. 
Im Antrunk ist das Bier spritzig-frisch, ausgewogen sauer. Zum Hauptteil wird diese schön sauer Note etwas runder, angenehm holzige Töne gesellen sich hinzu. Dabei leichte Essig-Anklänge. 
Der Nachgeschmack ist lang anhaltend, fruchtig-sauer und angenehm holzig-weich. 
--> Eine sehr tolle Gueuze! Schön rund-ausgewogen, nicht zu flach und nicht zu aufdringlich-sauer. Sehr zu empfehlen!!


Test vom 26.1.2011, Gebinde: Glasflasche	Noten: 13,13,12,14,13,14 - 13,40

small white head disappears fast. copper colour. aroma of brett-funk, balsamico, bit of solvent, maize. taste is lucious balsamico with long aftertaste. medium body and carbonation. what a treat, delicious ... what 6 years of aging can do! bottle 75 cl / bbf aug-2027

Tap at t Antwaerps Bierhuyske. Poured a clear light amber with a long lasting frothy white head. The aroma is huge acid yeast sour. Really in your face. The flavour is super sour with lots of grapefruit citrus on the palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation. This really clears the palate!

Bottle. Pours clear golden with a white head. Funk and horse blanket full on in the aroma along with super tart citrus fruits. Flavour is heavy sour, not subtle at all, and with a real dry finish. Medium bodied with light carbonation.
75cl bottle. The tartness and sourness in this Gueuze is quite high. Not too much carbonation. A good Oude Gueuze

2007 bottle 375 ml tasted Dec 1st 2013
Pours golden orange with a slim white head into a tulip. Massive sour acidic aroma, funked up with barnyard and horseblanket. The sourness and acidity is initially overpowering, but the palate starts to warm up as the beer does, and one tastes wood and even a bit of berry underneath the sour onslaught. Pretty nice even if relatively straightforward.

Questa Hanssens è sicuramente una delle migliori gueuze in circolazione. Ha un acidità netta e avvolgente che non si stempera nella nota dolciastra che carraterizza molte gueuze belghe. Ottimo prodotto. Pericolosamente beverina. Attendo con ansia il giorno in cui la troverò alla spina!

Bottle. The strong smell of yeast, quite sour with a hidden sweetness in the background. The head is medium large, white and foamy-creamy with a normal duration. The body is orange-red. The taste started rather sour, it gets velvety later on, the final finish ist soft. The body is rather light and very dry with a soft carbonation.

Bottle 375ml.
Pours golden with very low white head. Aroma is of barnyard, citrus, fruits, bretts. Somewhat faro-like. Taste is of pickles, barnyard, some acid (acetic?), sourness. Palate: Light body. Low carbonation. Overall: Refreshing. Surprising acid features (harsh) is what "sinks" this one. Unusual bugs. Still pretty good.

Bottle (375 ml). From Randall, thanks! Slightly hazy golden with a small white head and light lacing. Aroma is of barnyard, nice funk, citrus, acetic presence (a tad harsh) and hay. Taste is also acetic with citrus, barnyard, hay, funk and pickles. Light/medium body. Low carbonation. Dry. If it was not of the harsh acetic presence, it would be among the best of the style. Theres a lot of similarities with some acetic American Wild Ales. Good Gueuze with a nice barnyard presence.

Smells tart and fruity and maybe like it has some wild yeast in it. Cloudy pale amber with almost no head. taste is pretty sour with some fruit, intense. Not a whole lot of complexity, just sour. I dont know what to think, but for a sour its ok.

Bottle. Pours light orange with a small, white head. Smells like sour milk and brett. Tastes sour, lemons, light, very carbonated. Has a nice sourness to it but something just tastes off....good sourness but dont like the backbone it has, it tastes a bit rotten.
Pours hazy orange with white head. Aroma is very sour, acidic, wood and grapefruit. Flavour is sour, grapefruit and earthy.

Bottle, 10/28/2013. Pours toasted amber, thin white head dies to a splotchy haze on the surface, decent ring of lacing remains around the glass. Aroma is quite fruity with barnyard character, moderately sweet upfront overripe pear, orange and grapefruit must, transitions to earthy, dusty funk, wood. Taste is a touch sweeter than many traditional gueuze, but not overly so, with tart cider, pear notes, acidic character with some vinegar, fruitiness blends with oak in the finish. Light body, fairly crisp and dry. Decent for sure.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2013 Thanks to koelschtrinker. Lot A 750ml. Pours a slightly hazy copper color with a small off-white head. The smell is funky, musty,citric, acidic. The taste is musty, funky, acidic, plenty o citrus and grapefruit ending quite dry. Light in body with nice carbonation.
Another really good gueuze. Really funky and tart with the nice citrus flavors.

Bottle split with mBROsmer. Nice cloudy golden pour. Funky tart aroma. Taste is funky, tart, puckering, lightly sweet. Nice fruity palate. Citrus, tart grapes, grapefruit zest. Real crisp and refreshing.

Pours a golden orange color. Aroma is of huge barnyardy funkiness. Flavor is citrusy, acidic, tart, and funky. Cheese and barnyardy character dominate. Finish is tart and acidic. Very tasty gueuze.
(Lotnr: c)

More fruity than the average gueuze, lemony and nice hoppy aftertaste. Try it!

Rated by BrewTom

Bottle 375ml @ Geokkjer
Pours hazy deep golden with a small white head. Aroma has malt, sour, tart, barnyard and some citrus. Taste is light sweet and heavy sour with a long dry and sour finish. Body is medium, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.
375ml bottle @Cimmeria, Oviedo. Nice Gueuze, well executed, balanced, Some grapy, tart, acid, high carbonation. Nice one!

Bottle 375ml, january 2013. Pours a slightly hazy blond with small white head. Aroma is funky, barnyard, cheese and oak. Taste has lots of wood, earth and a long sour finish. Carbonation could be more lively. A very good gueuze which leans more towards Cantillon than 3F. Dry without being overly sour. Up there with the best of them.

Bottle@ Nüetnigenough Brussels, poured clear orange amber with medium head. Smells..sour and acidic, barnyard funky yeast and some lemon citric. Tastes..big and sour, acidity high with lemon notes. Gueuze with sour muscle!

Bottle at home from Ohtsuki. Lovely light golden orange colour with small white bubbly head. Aroma is nicely sour, very fruity, slightly tropical but with grapefruit sharpness. Only light funkiness/earthiness, but definitely comes through. Taste is differently balanced, lots of sourness at the start, real slap in the face then fades into something more fruity. Lot more funkiness in the taste than the aroma. The finish is more sweet and some of the flat creaminess that I associate with gueuze. Further down the sour edge diminishes a little bit, but it still starts with a punch. Quite different and pretty interesting.

UPDATED: AUG 28, 2013 Refrigerated corked and capped dark green bottle poured into a tulip. Pours slightly hazy deep golden with small/medium white head. Aroma is tart, medium body, low carbonation, and thin small bubble lacing. Taste is tart becoming more sour as it warms and earthy. Good gueuze.

A nice golden color with a moderate amount of carbonation. Started of clear, but grew cloudy from the sediment. Yummy yummy sediment. Aroma had a heavy barnyard note to it, nice esters and some almost doughy notes. Flavor seemed to be more tart than anything else, there was a subtle sweetness and some almost earthy notes. Carbonation was present on the palate, but not enough to be too gassy. Beer had a good mouth feel.

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2014 Bottle: Thanks, Kevin! Golden yellow body, mild chill haze. Foamy white head fades instantly. Aroma is insane funk and some tart fruit. Sweat sock, wet wood, muddled musty barnyard, some tart apple skins and wet hay. Taste is funky and tart as hell. Lots of tart, unripe apple skins and lemon rinds, very puckering. Lots of lactic acid and sourness with a touch of funk; musty oak, wet hay, and biting acidity. Crispy, wet, thin body and mouth feel.

A well balanced, decently complex sour showcasing barn and bright fruit finishing with a surprisingly mild-mannered creamy character

A clear, vibrant honey-amber body supports a short, tight off white head with several medium to extra large bubbles suspended throughout and fading quickly to a solid ring and thin island with a tapered, arching peninsula of lace
-
An assertive, potent layer of dusty, oaky hay pierces bright fruity characteristics of apricot, lemon, pineapple, mango, and grapefruit with faint floral accents and a rounding layer of banana and bubblegum on a slick, coating light-medium body introducing itself as a big acidic individual, but graciously opening to a neutral, mildly sweet, lightly drying finish with residuals bringing the focus back to oaky hay and banana; this one really mellows with warmth, with the sharpness migrating to the back of the drink

12.7oz notched bottle code Lotnr: H at 40º into TeKu
375 at my place with group. Pours orange. Aroma sour tarty greatness, cherry acidic. Taste is acidic sour and nice. Finish is long and sour. Mouthfeel is soft.
No head or lace. Vinegary nose with cobwebs, funky yeast, a bit dank and unrefined. Cheesy with horse blanket on the palate. Quite sour. Tasty. This was my go-to gueuze before I discovered Cantillon.
Love this beer. Lots of tart apples and funkiness going on. Reminds of champagne only not. Fruity and yummy. A half bottle is enough but great.

Bottle split with JF post fry up, 18/08/13.
Pours a hazed golden orange with a good sized frothy white head.
Nose is musty, dank wood, lemon rind, cobwebs, tarte apple skins.
Taste comprises dank wood, lemon rind, tarte grape skins, dry rot, musty, burnt hay, earthy, funk.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, crisp and dry in the execution.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Pours a clear bubbly gold from the bottle with no real head or lacing. Aroma is funky diapers, tart fruit, and champagne. Taste is less funky and more tart. Not bad.
Drucken på flaska på Brekeriet bar i Djurslöv. Så fantastiskt gott. Välbalanserad Gueuze, frisk, syrlig, torr, ren. Smak av äpple med tydlig fatkaraktär. Mer av detta tack.

Bottle... Poured deep, dark copper orange with a thin head. Some citrus and yeast spice on the nose with a hint of funk and wood. Lemon-lime citrus notes with some sour acidity and yeast spices. Not overly funky, but still nice to drink. Light apple tones along with other light fruits before the mildly musky, drying yeast finish.

I still dont understand this style of beer. Gueuze, and sours alike just boldly confuse me. Add some fruit and it makes sense! But this style just not something I would search out. Now on to the review of this Gueuze. The pour is very wine like in character, no head, even when swirled. Immediate tartness followed by a mellowing lime/sour taste. Appearance is dark piss yellow and super low carbonation. LOT # H Overall, tasty but not versus the higher price.

Pours a dark orangish bronze color, darker than usual for a gueuze, with a small but sustaining beige head. Aroma is somewhat mild, with a slightly perfumey citric tartness, wort, hay, and horse stable. Flavor is sharply sour, the kind of tingling sourness in the throat that feels like vinegar. Once youre accustomed to that, there are citric notes, along with dusty cellar and a honeyed maltiness in the finish. Id like to see this dried out a bit on the back end.
Oh how I love the gueuze. This is yet another example of the greatness of this style. Intense, tannine, sour and a touch of farm.
Wauw, lime juice explotion with a bitter aftertast and even longer sweetness once the sour and bitter have disappeared.

Powerful aroma, vinious, green apple, horse blanket, lime. It does fade a little quickly. Taste is lime, grape, granny smith apples, lemon juice to finish with some dust. 

Delicious, refreshing lambic.

UPDATED: AUG 8, 2015 Aroma is slightly sour, some hints of corn I think, metallic, almost a glorified adjunct. It?s very off-putting. Appearance is straw yellow, large white head. Taste is very sour, but the taste is like hard cider, tart apple flavor. Mouthfeel is very carbonated. Overall...the smell threw me off. I?m not a huge fan but it isn?t horrible.

20/07/2013 375ml bottle @ Mad for Beer. Dorata, limpida, schiuma bianca leggera, non molto persistente. Al naso sentori di stalla, agrumi, leggero balsamico e botte, non male, leggera nota acetica che pian piano prende il sopravvento. In bocca è acida aggressiva, bella complessa, note di botte, astringenza, agrumata e discretamente secca, leggero acetico. Corpo medio, carbonazione media. Non male, ma ho assaggiato gueuze migliori.

A tart fruity flavor but a little more sour and standard beer finish than I was expecting. It was very good, but Ill be the first to admit that Im not sure I know the difference between average, good and great.
Sour tart aroma. Damn sweet after. Cloudy golden color. Hefe like with champagne like head. Tart but very balanced start with a dry lemon after taste. Incredibly balanced.

Delicious sweet tarty fruit smells. A semi-translucent pearl gold. Tart start with a fizz that gets ya. The flavor fades to a dry earthy grape. Clean and light with an amazing dry finish that still leaves your mouth watering.

Bottle. Pours hazy light amber with stable off-white head. Clear vinous aroma with light fruity notes. Sour, vinous flavour with a lingering rough and vinous aftertaste and a dusty touch. If I didnt know better, I would swear it was an unblended Lambic. Really good.

Orangy, light amber in colour and a wee bit hazy with a very thin soft dark white head. Noses of cider and fruits. Lightly slick texture with apple cider notes developing a rather strong sour and light sweet taste on the palate. The finish is medium but develops a dryness which lasts long.
Hazy golden colour. Funky sour aroma. Tart, some vinegar and sourness, dry finish

A dark yellow beer with a quite small and white head. The nose of riped fruits, bananas, strong sourness, grapes. Nice, not so sour-attacking aroma. Taste is strongly sour, nice balanceing sweetness, dry earthyness, leather and some grapes. Medium bodied, sparkling carbonation. Tastefull and balanced beer, I like this Gueuze.

Pours hazy gold. Aroma is sour funky yeast. A good mixture of sour and spiciness.  Not overbearingly sour, but just enough. Has a good fruitiness to it. The yeast adds a little spice that separates it from most other lambics. Lots going on here with the yeast profile. A very good sour.

Slightly hazy old gold pour with a 1 finger, creamy eggshell head. Aroma is funky wet limestone, sour floral notes, fallen leaves, toast and cereal. Flavor is quite tart up front, vinegar and vitamin c, toast, tart fruit, basement funk and stone fruit. Light in body and dry with a nice and crisp, lightly acidic feel and blanketing, moderate strength carbonation. Damn good.

UPDATED: SEP 29, 2013 29 sept 2013, bottle. Dirty dark yellow. Nose is artificial lemon juice. Thin body and mildly fizzy. Really tastes like lemon juice, with brett, slightly sweet. Very nice. 

(Original rating 8 3 8 3 15 = 3.7)
27 June 2013, bottle. Yellow, faintly cloudy. Nose is very tart. Thin body and fizzy. Cherry pits, moderately tart, some cobwebs. Pretty nice! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a golden beer with a not very long lasting head. Smells pretty sour and a little sweet. Taste is good. Pretty sour.
2013 - 06 - 21 375 ml corcked bottle. orange golden colour. small white head. fruit and earth in aroma. sour taste.

Pour from a 750ml bottle, thanks to Jimmy for sharing. Wow, man that is deliciously sour! First sip is a wave of sour that washes slowly washes over and encompasses the entire palate. Mildly hazy sort of darker orange color. Minimal off white head, little swirl on the surface, just a few loose dots of lace. Big woody barrel aroma. Some nice funky mustiness. Some complex fruitiness in there too for sure, something citrusy or tropical. One of the better, more enjoyable geuzes Ive ever had. Starting to get this style figured out..

Aroma: Stable, manure, old lake, Hay infusion.Appearance: A foggy straw colored beer. A white head with small lacing and good curtains.Taste: Tasting sweet fruity, marmalade and soft wet hay.Palate: Medium carbonation, small bubbles, a soft texture. A good body with a somewhat dry finish.Overall: Can it be better?Note: Bottle 375 ml at a De Klomp tasting. Reviewed 2013-06-15.

Awesome! Pours with a quickly dissipating white head and a golden crystal color. Aroma is very complex, with notes of lemon-acidity, apples, must and hay. Taste is sour on the sides of the tongue, bitter up front with steely apples as the backbone. Great lively mouthfeel with lingering tartness. Overall a very great beer in a very great style.

[bottle]
Potent fruity aroma, fresh strawberries, faint ethyl acetate, sour peaches, white grapes, cranberries. Hazy, effervescent orange under a lasting, white cover and thick ring. Sour, pickle juice flavour that is mouth puckeringly sour with bright fresh fruit. Light body, high carbonation. Really solid lambic.
Okay...not a big gueuze fan there are only a few guezes i drunk that i liked...and im lucky this is one of em.

Hazy amber appearance.  Aroma of barnyard funk and slight vinegar acidity.  Flavor is funk and sourness, some tannic qualities, leather, horse blanket, sour, bitterness, grapefruit peel, overall barnyard funk.  Carbonation was champagne like.  Finishes dry and sour.  Very nice.

12.7 oz green bottle with a LOTNR G notch.

A - Pours a hazy golden honey color with a white head that forms a nice collar.

S - Funkadelic! Sour cheese comes to mind, sour lacto, vinegar, earthy basement musk, rotten wood.

T - Bright lemons, peaches, apples, a puckering and salty sourness begins to come through full force and turns to a sharp acidic apple cider vinegar character. A sharp orange citrus bite rides to the end finishing crisply acidic and slightly astringent.

M - Medium body, low carbonation, puckering sour, crisp.

By far the funkiest aroma I have ever smelled from a beer. Bright tangy sourness with a serious musky funk. The acidity almost burns the throat. This was a joy to drink.

Serving type: bottle

07-29-2012

Lee at the Brick Store gave this to Westmeister in celebration of his birthday.  I was lucky enough to get half the bottle.  Pours a hazy yellow with white head and a wonderful lemony scent.  The sour flavor stays on your tongue well after the gulp has been swallowed.  Supercharged carbonation which fits the style well.  Bottle - Brick Store Pub - Decatur, GA

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2013 Pours a burnt hazy golden color with a white bubbly head. Very bright tart fruit notes on the nose, lots of barnyard funk and grassy, lactic acid, and slightly peppery. Very tart taste, a musty funkiness, lemons, grassy and peppery, and maybe a bit of white grape. Very tart beer with a very dry finish. Quite tasty.

2011 350 ml bottle from Brickstore cellar.  Birthday bash - thanks Lee!!  Pours a cloudy orange pour with a ring of residual white head after sitting and leaving it for an unnoticed bit.  Smell is barnyard, grassy, lemony, lacto.  Fantastic nose.  Taste is light sour tart, lemony, a bit funky, earthy, fantastic.  Dry finish with lingering smooth tartness.  Story of the evening, company made this a fantastical beer memory.  And the beer was damn fine.

375 ml bottle poured into a tulip. Pours hazy deep orange body with a small head, minimal lacing. Aroma is strong sour, tart fruit, wood. Taste is medium acidic and sweet citrus up front, mildly sour and bitter to finish. Medium body, flat carbonation and a long, dry sour finish.
Overall: Tasty and enjoyable. Not too sweet or heavy; refreshing while still complex to be interesting.

Bottle at Akkurat. 98 vintage. Light hazy orange liquid with small white head. Aroma of apples, barnyard, minerals, lemons, red berries and lacto. Taste is dry and medium sour with notes of minerals, apples and funk. Medium bodied with low carbonation. Nice.

Bottle. Musty funky barnyard, sour fruity, woody aroma.  Hazy light copper with a moderate, quickly dissipating off-white head. Funky, sour citrus, and woody flavor. LIght body., lively carbonation, dry finish. Quite sour

Bottle---> tulip.  Pours a light orange with a one finger head and spotty lace.  Head never really disappears.  Smell is super funky barnyard and sour lemon.  Tastes very sour and leathery.  Nice crisp palate with good carbonation.  I love this beer- great representation of the style.

Slightly hazy yellow orange in color... Aroma of tart citrus, almond... Flavor is tart citrus, lemon sourness, oak, malts, hint of smoke... Notes of lemon funk, off finish, amazingly tart... Delicious 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Small bottle shared.  Dark golden and slightly hazy with a white head.  Nice tart Belgian yeast aroma with a similar flavor.  Smooth light sourness.  Light chalky finish.  Nice OG.
Golden pour with some light orange tinges.  Fluffy white head.  Sour up front, some stone fruit, yeasty, dusty notes, earthy goodness.  Loved it.
Bottla at M-Cafe, Leuven: Pale amber coloured brew with an good tart taste with some fruitiness, drybitter indeed and not so sour due the blending i think.

Bottle 37,5 cl, BBE 07.08.2030. Pours dark golden in color with a small whitish head. A bit funk, some wheat and light notes of vinegar in aroma. Tart mouthfeel at first. Some lemon mixed with a bit of sour notes in taste. Just awesome. Got inspired by the Toer de Geuze 2013, so I had to open a bottle of Hanssens Oude Gueuze for this occasion. Actually this isnt that tart towards the end, instead some more softer and fruitier notes appear. No need to say that this is a really tasty gueuze after all with some lingering sour notes in finish.

375ml bottle. Pours clear golden amber without much head, carbonation is very slight.  Aroma is lots of barnyard funk, leather, fragrant cheese and some notes of sweet fruits and tart citrus.  From these distinct aromas you would expect something overpowering in the taste, but its not that at all; its light citrus sourness and some great earthy funkiness. Very balanced on the palate, moderately acidic and highly drinkable. Wish it was a little more carbonated but still highly enjoyable and a great gueuze.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy orange with small frothy white head leaving spotty lacing. The aroma is sour fruit vinegar and strong funk. Thin mouthfeel with sweet fruit and light vinegar with very tart finish. Easy to drink, a very good gueuze.

UPDATED: APR 26, 2013 Bottle in Euston Tap. Colour is clear amber minimal white head gone very quickly. Nose is vinegar, cider, sour tartness, sour cooking apple, slight farmyard. Taste is crisp white apple sour and tartness, acidic bite, slight farmyard but with a refined slight vinous edge. Also nice tangy burnt sour tartness that I love in Gueuze. This is a good un.

375mL bottle, pours a cloudy orangey gold with a small white head. Aroma brings out medium acidic notes, light horse blanket, very low funk for a gueuze, and some tart apricot-like fruits. Flavour brings out lightly tart apricots, medium acidity, low barnyard funk, and some light white wine-y notes. Finishes medium acidic and a little vinous. Very dry palate, with no sweetness and medium sourness for the style -- fairly low funky quality for the style. Excellent stuff.
Thanks to Chris for this. Pours cloudy orange with good head, some lacing. Nice and meaty. Has apple and apricot. Sour cherry. Some apple cider vinegar sense. Finishes sour.
Bottle at hbf13. Almost clear deep golden color, minimal white head. Strange aroma of factories, stables, sour, apples, earth, fruits. Nice sour taste, fruits, stables. Interesting.
Aroma is lots of everything, mostly good but a bit of bad. Golden yellow small head. Heavy sourness on the taste but some softer notes to balance it. Fairly long sour finish, good stuff.
July 2010. Sampled at a tasting. Definitely an acquired taste and one that I have later come to enjoy. Citrus notes combined with skunky and cheesy aromas. Sour finish.

Aromas of lemon, nectarine, and flowers.  Hazy yellow-orange with a quickly fading, white head.  Sour, bitter, tart, and earthy.  Light bodied, snappy, and pretty clean with some lingering lemon flavor.

Pale yellow pour with a small white with a nice tart apricot and sour aroma, taste is similar and damn tasty.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

37,5cl Geers - Layers upon layers of cultured yet wild tastes and aromas: old lemon and grapefruit rinds left alone to their own design, rhubarb compot thrown in for good measure, a combined bitter-sour palate-cleanser to dream of. Nose is slightly more acidic/balsamic than the immensely complex astringent and yet mature taste, where some brown sugar and lactic acid seeps in. Style-defining and to my palate more layered that the top puckerers...
What a great drink after a long and thirst bringing hike through the forest. Nice sourness, dusty. Just what I needed.
75 cl bottle from the hopduvel in Gent. Light orange golden body with very large longlasting head. Very sour citrus taste. **

Bottle.  Pours a murky amber with thin but very long lasting off-white head with soapy racing.  Nose of barn funk, lemon rinds, vinegar, lactic acid, acetone.  Good tartness, lemon and wheat flavors with good deal of funk.  This got really good as it warmed.
Una delle migliori oude gueuze prodotte al mondo. Il gusto è equilibratissimo e lacido va oltre ogni immaginazione di piacevolezza. Annata 2011 da 75 cl.

A delightful pop from the cork and this poured out sunshine golden straw color.  Light and a bit cloudy.  A voluptuous head of white foam that settled to a thin cap and collar and champagne effervescence. Its heaven to look at.  The nose is strong and delicious with yeast, brett funk, barnyard and hay, musty wood a bit of vinegar and sweet hint of white grape and citrus. Taste is mouth watering, juicy and sour.   Lemon, plenty of earthy funk, sour  with some pear and green apple. Malt is light grain.  Its simplicity on the palate and each sip has you asking for more.  Nice dry finish and a little oak and vanilla  in the aftertaste.  This was a wild and refreshing geuze.

Bottle. Pours clear dark gold orange with a nice soapy white head that settles to a film. Aroma is funk tart wet leather and rotten pear/apple. Taste is sour bitter and acidic with hints of pear apple wood some wet leather and tannins. Palate is fizzy and drying.

Semi-clear golden. Bubbly/fizzy, lasting white head. Lots of carbonation. Aroma is funky, acidic, fruity. Great on the palate - alot going on. Crisp, tart, sour, fizzy - a nice bite. Flavor is tart fruit, sour, earthy, funky, some woody.

pours a very light orange color with decent carbonation and a nice white head. 
initial aroma a little funky, bold, sour.  After the initial whiff, still sour, with a little fruity smell, possibly pear.  
Initial taste. woah, sour.  Sweet and sour, like a sour patch kid or something of the sort.  pear.

37.5cl. Bottle, best before 07/08/2030, Lotnr L.  This smells sharp and sour, the appearance a cloudy yellow with a light small head, very light carbonation. Taste is medium sour lingering on the palate as a good gueuze should. Its a fairly smooth light gueuze, not as overwhelming as other examples but that is not necessarily a negative, depends on what you are looking for. Very similar to Boon Oude Gueuze to my untrained mouth.

Blend di Lambic di annate diverse, dallaroma piacevolmente fruttato e gusto acidulo.  La seconda fermentazione avviene allinterno delle bottiglie , che vengono conservate e fatte maturare per un minimo di sei mesi in cantina a temperatura costante. Non mi piace, troppo acida per il mio gusto.

A little bit shifted towards "daily beers" compared to Cantillon. Easier to drink. Probably would be nicer in a sunny day after work. Taste is more balanced however "shorter". A little bit sweet for what Id expect from gueuze, but not in any bad way. And a very pleasent wheat notes.
Bottle. Poured yellow with pillowy white head. Nice funk and fruit aroma. Tastes tart, funky and fruity and is quite effervescent. Really good and drinkable Gueze.
750ml Bottle from Knightly. Funky, Grapes, Floral, Citrus, very barnyard. Not quite as sour as I would like but a very enjoyable Gueuze.

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2013 Blind tasting off 18 current available Gueuzes. Shared with Mathieu87.
Appearance: nice head, but fades fast.
Nose: horse blanket, lemon.
Taste: sour and dry, tart, lemon, amazing gueuze!

Light yellow. Decent head
Lots of oranges. Some kiwi. hint of fecal matter
Lots of sweetness but hidden by a very tart lactic almost vinegar taste..not too much but its a pretty sour beer. I get a sweet peach taste. Yeah, sweet and tart. Not bad but couldnt drink more than a small glass of this due to the sourness

Pours a orange golden color with a trace of fizzy foam that dissipates quickly. On the nose there is a bit of tangy honey, some fruity nectar and a nice funky dose if basement dankness. The palate is pretty round with a lack of much carbonation.. creating a mouthcoating mouthfeel that is slightly lackluster. Nice stonefruit flavors and a dry funky finish. Not bad a touch to sweet and slightly flabby.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2013 Bottle from the Bottle Shop; hazy orange pour with foam white head, citric tart aroma, sour tart taste not overwhelmingly sour just right leaves a pleasant tingly sensation on my tongue, some barnyard funk. Likey!

Bottle from Beers of Europe shared with Reuben at my stylish (no really it is!)  back bar (The Lord Alwold). Light amber pour. Nose of mature cheese and some light citrus. Flavours of green apples and lemon and lots of sour acidic notes. Sour, dry finish.

(Bottle shared with [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Lord Alwold) Pours amber colour with a medium white/off white head. Aroma/taste acidic sour and dry orchard fruits, mature cheese, pine woody notes. This being my first ever lambric-gueuze its hard to know how to rate it, not a great fan of the style but appreciate nonetheless (D13)

Strong sour aroma, maybe notes of citrus. Colour with amber/orange with lots of sediment and nice white head. Taste is yeasty, sour, but kind of a citrus bitterness in the middle. Interesting. A great gueuze.

Bottle, atleast a few years old.Surprisingly good indeed. Good citric tartness & funk (strong). Notes of oak and vanilla.
Bonus: Inside the bottle I could smell earthy onions, new one for me.

Surprisingly great gueuze here.  Aroma is nice tropical fruits, funk, light oak notes.  Nice effervescent mouthfeel with a medium to high tartness and a nice dryish finish.  9 gueuzes tried at a blind tasting and this one was my winner.
Great gueuze, very tart and not much complexity, lingering tartness, a big fab of this one

Orange with a small, ultra fizzy head. Aroma is funky, sweet, fruity. Medium body with small, tingly carbonation. Flavor has a nice solid barnyard funk, sour fruit, lightly sweet berries.  Finish is full of funk and tart fruit. Lightly dry. Good stuff.

Pours hazy orange with a large, fast fizzling head. Smells sour, straight sour. Taste is several kinds of sour. Medium-bodied with a prickly texture and less than average mouth-carbonation, Hanssens Oude Gueuze finishes with a mild lingering sourness.

Hazy orange copper pour fluffy white head. Can smell the sour barnyard funk as soon as I opened the bottle. Leather light sweetness and plenty of sour punch. Grassy floral notes Effervescent and sticky mouth feel. Yumm.
Hazy golden, lot of foam initially. Very sour aroma, some yeast and herbs. Citric taste, slightly bitter at the end.

Hazy yellow with pillowy white head. Smells fucking awful--like puke. Like puke after drinking a lot of MGD. Mouth-puckering sour. If you hold your nose, its not awful. The palate isnt terrible, but the smell is overpowering and disgusting. Past the disgustingness, there is some sour cherry flavor.

This is gross, people. This is not good beer. This is the drinking equivalent of nuclear hot wings...nuclear hot wings dont taste good, theyre made for people who try to "outdo" each other by supersizing their food. This beer doesnt taste good. Its overdone. No one wants to drink something that smells like puke unless their palate is shot and they are trying to outdo their buddies.
In conclusion, I will step off my soapbox and advise that if you have taste buds an enjoy things that taste good, do not drink this beer.

Bottle. Brown orange pour with white head that disappeared quickly. Lemon, bread, flower, tea.  Initial feel is tea, herb and carbonation.  Bitter and sour finish.  Medium body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very spritzy. Fruity, lemon and apple. Horse blanket. Very tart but quaffable. Excellent gueze.

Bottle. Orange hazy. Nose has old tart apple, hay, stable/horseblanket, sour berries. Body is medium. Tart, refreshing. A lot of rhubar, grass, acidity. Oak, some vanilla. Pretty good. A distinct soft oaky horseblanket in this one, very nice!-- bb/h

Bottle from liquor express - why do I keep buying gueuze, I dont like the tartness, though I get why others enjoy it. Anyway, pours an effervesiant clear orange. Aroma is summer and tropical fruits, ie fruit cocktail. Taste is medium sour and tart. Palate is dry. Overall, solid.

Bottle from liquor express. Pours yellow with a thin white head that rapidly disappears. Has a very fruity nose. Shockingly theres a lot tartness on the tongue. A bit of vanilla on the tongue as well. A fair amount of fruit on the finish. Nice!

Bottle. Pretty clear golden with a fizzy white head. Earthy, musty wine barrel aroma with nice sour apple and lemon highlights. Very bright palate with lemon and vanilla tastes followed by a dry oaky lemon zest finish. Very good.
this is a nice geuze! its very good to age but drink it fresh as well and you will find all the yummie stuff there!

Deep orange, a bit cloudy, almost no head. Lovely nose of summer berries (wild strawberries, red currant and morello cherries to name a few) dry apple cider, vinegar and funk. Very fruity in a berry kind of way for being an oude gueuze. A little sweetness matches the tartness well. Not very extreme, but very well balanced and that lovely berry character. Fantastic!

Bottle. Pours a dark gold color with a lasting white head. Aroma is a funky, cheesey smell. Taste is slightly oxidized but very lush and acidic. A mild oak vanilla lurks in the background. Pretty nice old world geuze.

Into a flute. Half finger of head. Strawberry colored body with lots of bubbles. Looks pretty.
Smells like fresh fruits, mostly apples. 
Wow taste. Starts a little sweet, then quickly moves to a dry sour and bitter taste. Quick ending.
Crisp and fizzy texture. 
My first of this style so I am not sure what they are supposed to be like. However, I enjoyed this.

Clear golden straw color. Slight white colored head. Fades to a layer of bubbles that last for a while. Minimal lacing. Aroma of funk, and lime, with a slight cheesiness to it. Taste is a nice twang reminiscent of a unsweetened lime juice.  Nice earthy tone. A residual sweetness somehow sneaks in. Very refreshing.

Bottle poured a golden orange color with a covering of white foam. Aroma has lemon, oak, grape skin, mild tartness, and some fruit. Mouth feel is light and crisp and the carbonation is sturdy. Flavor has lemon, clean tartness, light fruit, wood, and a lingering dry finish. Well rounded and easy to enjoy.

Bottle, shared with Kjempetorsken & wife @ Amundsen, Oslo. :-) Looks slightly hazy orange in my glass, covered with a small white head retention. Nose is horseblanket, straw, lemon and hints of peaches. Taste is sour lemony horseblanket tones, straw and hints of red berries. Moderately tart, with a thin body, sparkling body and dry finish. Mellow and nice.

Bottle. Pours gold with a massive white head, good retention/little lace. Aroma of horseblanket, lactic, wood, lemon, white grape, dust. Taste is intense sour, wood, lemon, white grape. Palate is slick, average carbonation, sour finish. Good.

375ml bottle. Pours a rather intense amber with almost no head. Figure 8 of foam left in the middle of my glass and a slight ring of the stuff. Smells great. Sour, woody, funky. Theres something I want to describe in there but I dont have the words. Its all funk on the palate up front. Theres a petrol sort of quality...in a good way. The funk sort of rolls in on itself and becomes sour through the finish. Theres a woody feel in there as well. The finish has some teeth that arent the most pleasant but otherwise this stuff is great.
Bottle. Clear gold, white head that disappears and leaves some lacing. Nose is lemon pledge, garlic, must, hay. Taste is tart and bitter lemon, some grass, garlic. Very crisp.

Decent gueuze but not up to par with others sampled today.  Pours light yellow with moderate head and lacing.  Has a subdued funk, not as much as you would want .  Clean quick finish that leaves you wanting more.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2012 1955 bottle compliments of Frank, split with a small crew at the "end of the world tasting". Couldnt belive we were drinking a 70 year old gueze, cork had to get pushed through but we made do with cheese cloth and a strainer. Notes were peach, oak, sour, dust, lemon, and sea cheese. Low carbonation but what the heck do you expect with a beer this old. Truly a beer I will remember for ages. Huge thanks for sharing. 1988 bottle with Frank, and Bill last week. Golden copper pour with tiny head if any. Aroma and Taste are ultra cheese funk, lots of wood, lemon skin and other acidic fruit. Low to medium carbonation. Very dusty and complex tasting lambic. Awesome.

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2012 9/13/12
Had kept this one for probably 6 months and was ready for it.  Cracked after a meal.

Pours a dark orange.  Wasnt a lot of pop from the cork, so makes sense not a lot of bubble.  Slight lace on top.

Smell is funk, sour, wet wool, and fruity.  I typically love the smell, but perhaps the lactic acid is a touch over the top for my liking 

Taste is puckering, fruity sourness.  Youd think the brett would be more over the top given the nose, but it isnt which is a good thing IMHO.  Its a sipper though.  The follow-through is the best part of it.  Really pleasant tasty sour follows through to the end, leaving just a bit of lingering flavor.  This is why I drink this beer.

Still a newb in this style, but mouthfeel leaves a little to be desired.  More carbonation would satisfy, of course.  Left it on its side in wine fridge for 6 months, perhaps should have stored upright.  Still enjoyed and will revisit. 



---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours old gold with white head. Nose/taste of aged cheese, funk, splintered wood, tart fruit and lemon zest. Medium body. Semi-dry finish with a moderate pleasant acidity.

August 30, 2012 bottle at BVerys tasting. Orangish yellow pour with some head.  Earthy dirty funk in the aroma.  Taste was, well, like a typical lambic.  Thanks to Jake for sharing and providing the official pronunciation of the beer!
Bottle: Gold pour with white head. Sour fruit like orange and peach. ThanksJake!
Bottle - thanks Jake! Rich golden pour with a white head. Aggressive sour aroma and taste - barnyard, sour fruit, very tart taste. Very good.

2012.08.29 - bottle 37.5cl - orange coloured and a creamy white head that lasts. Acidic in the nose and i imagine myself the spiders and cobwebs.  An explosion in the mouth - assertive acidity, passion fruit, citrus.  Taste holds on in your mouth.  "oh, the alcoholic afternoons - when we sat in your rooms - they meant more to me than any, than any living thing on earth "

Clear golden colour, firm white head. Aroma of citrus, barn, brett, apricot and peach. Quite tart flavour, acidic, citrus, lots of brett notes. Acidic finish, tart citrus, silage and apricot. Quite fresh.
Nice one!
(From 37,5cL bottle @ Kor, Retie)

375 mL bottle from The Nook in Huntsville, AL.

The beer is hazy and light orange hued, with an inch of white head that fades to nothing after a few moments. The aroma is of authentic Belgian gueuze: funk, straw, farmyard, light citrus. The taste is very pleasant, with a subtle biting sharpness in the finish. The acetic feel in the back end is more prominent here than in some of my favorite gueuzes. Overall, a solid example of the style, and definitely worth a try.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 05-15-2011
Bottle. Hazy golden pour. Aroma of barnyard, funky and nicely round brett. Flavor is fruity, sour, orange, peach, very much fruit sourness, citrus. Sharp but nice. Slightly bitter in the finish.

A truly wonderful beer. Thanks to Ashley for sharing this with me. A hazy drab orange-golden hue with a soft white head. Nose of mildly musky sweet tart candies. As tart as can be without overdoing it. Citrus, orange rind, and tangy lemon. Finishes with a tart lingering prickliness that is very quenching and satisfying. Dangerously delicious.

drank this one thnx to gEUS at the tasting with dennoman, 15 years old version .
now, i DONT like geuze. i drained the other i drank after one sip. its just sour, thats al. undrinkable. but this kinda changed thing in that way of thinnking. this was way more balanced, definetley sour, but still a nice taste. definetley drinkable, i even had a second shot of the bottle. way better than feared and expected, also a very nice treat since its 15 years old... glad to know there IS a geuze i can enjoy. but is it equaly good when young???

enjoyed from a 75 cl bottle

Big bottle vintage 2010 at Amundsen.
Golden color, some foam.
Low / medium intensity stable aromas.
Medium body & high complexity.
Good sourness, but very well balanced.
Very enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Classic lambic. Very sour, not overly fruity. This is a style Im still trying to appreciate, and this is better than average.
Orange amber with a thin white head. The nose shows loads of fermented apples and some oaky notes. Medium bodied with tart apples, lychee and some yeast components. Bone dry finish.

Small bottle from 2003 - thanks Josh. Light amber with a frothy off white and brittel head. Extremely sour, tart and dry; there is an overlay of faint apple and wood; surprising amount of carbonation although mild, full body, tartness and sour continue with a great long lip-smacking tartness. Delicious.
Bottle. Aroma of tart apples, lemon, basement and mold. Flavour is quite tart with lots of grape notes and a little apple sweetness as well. Very nice.

375 ml. bottle. Shared with Gabe. Pours a huge but short lived, off white head, with some lacing, over a hazy gold (SRM 5) body......nose is musty cellar, heavy barnyard, light hints of citrus fruits, apple, pear.........taste is barnyard, sour apple, barest hints of floral honey, finishing with a lingering sourness, with hints of bitter......mouth feel light of medium, carbonation makes a creamy layer on the tongue. This hits the style with all the complexity in aroma and flavor expected. The only flaws are the short lived head, and the relative lack of effervescence. BJCP 8/3/15/4/7

375ml bottle. Cloudy gold/brass orange colour with moderate white head. Smells like white grape and musty basement. Sour is intense but not as much as I was expecting. Some mushroom and maybe some bitterness too. Body is quite dry. Overall, more balanced than some lambics Ive had.

Bottle @ Nuetnigenough, Bruxelles. Clear golden with a lasting white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, barnyard, woody and citrus. Flavor is medium sweet and rather acidic. Dry and rather acidic finish. 170712

UPDATED: APR 28, 2017 Pours hazy golden with a low head. Aroma is very sour malts and yeast. Flavor is sour malts, apple and yeast. Sublime.
(280417) Re-rate from a bottle @ One Pint Pub. Wow. Aroma has sweet malts and caramel but its still sour. Incredible. Same score as before.

375 ml bottle purchased over two years ago at Holiday Wine Cellar ($7.99).  Finally opening this on a hot summer day!  Pours a hazy amber hue with a thin layer of white-ish foam.  Aroma of burnt pasta (?!), barnyard, lemon, wood, soft cheese, leather, with some sweet honey.  Flavor of citrus-y balsamic, tart lemon peel, sour unripe green apple, funky yeast, and wet oak.  Significant sour bite here, but not overly so and with a hint of sweetness at the end.  Nice complex gueuze.  (701, 711)

Bottle at home with my wife. Poured a clear, golden orange color, with a small white head that quickly dissipated. Aroma is funk, cheese, wax, green apples, lemon, and bread. Taste is sour grain, musty, pear, champagne, tart apples, and light funk. Very well-balanced, crisp, refreshing, and very tart. Mouthfeel is light and perfect for summer with fizzy carbonation. Another classic gueuze and very delicious.

I freakin love lambics so this review may be biased. Pours golden amber with a bit of a haze. Strong citrus on the nose. Tart green apple, sour, bitter, so good!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle @ home. Slightly hazy deep amber orange with a small white head. The nose is sharp wood, citric acid, funky moldy cheddar cheese and light butterscotch. The taste is quite funky white grape, acerbic tangy fruits and more cheese. Yeast. Sharp. Sweet dry woody finish. Light body, soft carbonation. Overall, OK.

37.5 cL bottle from Reading Beer Festival into a Karmeliet glass at home.  Clear amber coloured with a short lived head, and a bit fizzy.  Typical gueuze aroma, sharp but fairly decent.  A little sharp, dry but not fiercely sour.  One of the better gueuzes Ive tried.
Good golden color, crisp Gueuze-y smell. Taste is a little mild for gueuze. I prefer a stronger sour bite. Overall very drinkable and a good intro to the world of gueuze/lambic varieties.

750 ml bottle.  No date, but I suspect it was bottled fairly recently.  Pours a slightly hazy golden amber with a small white head that has decent retention and leaves close to no lacing on the glass.  The aroma has a strong minerally note, a slight sulfur note, and some light lemon.  The initial taste has some sweetness with lemon, mineral, brett, and some light apple.  The finish is tart with some brett.  Medium body.  Low carbonation.  This was drank with 3F Oude Geuze and Cantillon Classic Geuze.  This was the worst of the three, but was still enjoyable.  It isnt quite as complex and has a bit more sweetness.

Poured from bottle, pours a hazy golden with a thin white head, the aroma has a lot of funk mixed in with some fruit as well, the flavor has a decent amount of vinegar on the front end with a sour bite in the finish, the barnyard funk really comes through, not bad.

no dating on bottle, id suspect a few years old at the max but most likely a year or so. pours a hazy gold with little to no head. light ring of bubble around the glass. not much pop on the cork either. lots of deep concentrated lemon up front. a light zesty sourness behind that. oak scent through out. the lemon is fairly strong through out. faint peach, apricot, and white grape. sourness is middle of the road but hits you at the right time. oak is quite tame. very refreshing and wet. very light tingle that like the sourness, has its bite at the right time. not much dryness here, quite wet and light. this was good, quite good. really great flavor through out. i plan on buying a bunch more.
(bottle) clear light amber colour with small white head; aromas of lemon, bit metallic, some basement and barnyard; refreshing, clean very sour flavour; very good

Pours a rusty ruby red with a beige head with not head retention. The nose starts with a sweet cinnamon an then a big stinky camembert cheese with a hints of  a barnyard/horse blanket smell. After it is followed by cherries and green apples. The noses finishes with a apple cider smell. Wow, shes got a bit of funk in her. The pallets starts with hints of sour cherries with bursts of green apple. Th middle has leather and oak. The finishes is long and complex with a bits of bitterness and a little astringent. Over all a delicious beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Säuerlich-kirschiger Geruch mit deutlicher Holznote. Antrunk sauer, kirschig. Mittig holzige Noten, kirschsauer und deutlich bittermandelig. Im Abgang zunehmende bis starke Säure, dabei kirschig und trocken ausfallend.
Vermutlich ein gelungenes Bier - Ist mir aber eindeutig zu sauer.

Bottle: hazy orange with thin white head. Aroma is sweaty sock funky with a strong tart nose.  Flavor rings in with a mouth puckering cherry tartness, add a dash of lemon, some barnyard funk, and a little over ripe soft cheese.  Overall, I found the beer interesting, but lacking without some sweetness.

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2016 10 cl sample @ Gastropub Tuulensuu Gueuze blind tasting. 2007? Vintage. BBE 07.08.2027.
Originally rated on 20100925. (6+3+7+3+15)
Pours clear orange color with no head. Faint aroma of grass, grapes, fruits and some yeast. Flavor of rose hip, goose berries, mild grapes and earth.
Placed #3 of 15.

375 ml bottles (2000 & 2010 vintages) @ Tammela Vintage Tasting, BBE 2020 and 2030 respectively.
Quite funky notes on the 2000 vintage, vingear-y. 2010 is much more pleasant and fruitier. More aggressive tart finish on the 2010 vintage.
The aroma is sour, farmhouse.  The appearance is hazy yellow, white head.  The flavor is like the aroma, sour, lemon.  The finish is lemon, sour, puckering.  Some farmhouse elements.  Nice.

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2012 Tasted @ Gastropub Tuulensuu geuze blind tasting 2012. #1/15 overall ratingBBE 2027, 2007 vintage(?) - 
Pours dark clear orange with a tiny head. Aroma of smooth wooden notes, tart fruits and some sourness. Taste of tart fruits, some dry sourness and berries. Finish is slightly sour and tart with currants. Well balanced, tasty.

375ml bottle from Discount Liquor Milwaukee. Pours a cloudy amber color with a white head. Aroma is mild, citrus, lemon. Medium on the palate with lively carbonation. Flavor is sour, funky, lemon, oaky, yeasty, with a light oaky finish. A solid Gueuze.
Poured a slightly hazy amber color with a fizzy off-white head. Aroma was notes of citrus, touch of wood, tart and funk. Flavor was mouth puckering tartness, pretty enjoyable.

Pours very hazy orange, with small head that disappeared quickly.  Aroma is cidery, and some maybe slightly rotten oranges. Taste is immediately sour, with sharp oranges. Light bitterness that goes away quickly leaving more orange behind.  This is my second lambic ever, and I want more!

12.7oz bottle into a tulip.

Pours a hazy orange with a tiny ring of bubbles along the top of the beer. Really lacking in carbonation.

Aroma has moderate amounts of barnyard funk but not as much as some other examples of the style. Also a little bit of fruit.

Tons of sourness at first leading to a moderate earthiness with the barnyard notes somewhat muted. I am also picking up some fruit, mainly cherries, throughout but becoming more noticeable towards the finish.

I thought this was a decent gueuze but somewhat lacking in the funk/barnyard area. The sourness is quite puckering but I would have liked more funk. I would drink it again, though.

First time trying this one, served alongside the Raspberry and Kriek.

A - Pours murky golden yellow with a nice one finger tall white head, quickly dissipating down to a small ring around the outside of the glass, leaving light trails of lace down parts of the glass.

S - Smells of the typical barnyard funk, light sourness, wet leather, lemon and some damp basement must. I prefer a little more fruitiness in my gueuze nose but this one was still pretty good.

T - Starts off with quite a bit of lactic sourness but it fades rather quickly leaving hints of musty earth, barnyard funk, leather and a bit of lemon twang. The flavors work really well together and it was very easy to drink. Finish is pretty dry, lingering on the pallet for quite awhile after consumption.

M - Slick feel like the others but the flavors are more mild, helping keep everything in check. Still a little light on the carbonation but it isnt as big of a deal as with the other two.

O - The best of the bunch for sure. Where the Kriek and Raspberry fail, this one excels. Tone down the overly aggressive sourness and this one could be great. As it stands now, a solid gueuze that is definitely worth the lower than average price tag.

Bottle to snifter (courtesy of Dutchs). Looks good; just like a good geuze should. Smells mixed; barnyard like a motherfunker, but with some calf poop in there somewhere. Tastes decent. Mouthfeel is average. I cant get over the smell of baby shit on this one.

In bottle from Craig. Pours a  light golden colour with a decent white head. A lovely horse blanket aroma with some lemon citrus notes. A similar lemon citrus flavour upfront with sour grapefruit and a balsamic sourness also. Moderate carbonation and CO2 prickle with a dry finish. Very nice.

Love this one. Up front big tart lemon. Middle and finish just seem to get even more sour. Pours straight orange with a head that disspiates quickly. Bottle is Lotnr F whatever that means. Bought a year ago. Big carbonation in the mouth and very light mouthfeel.
Great stuff.
Bottle at the J. Clyde. Hazy dark yellow pour with a thin white head. Scent is earthy and musty. Taste is big time tart/sour. I dont get the love for this style at all.
Källardoft. Trevlig smak av syrliga äpplen, men en mycket sympatisk och snäll geuze - nästan lite för snäll

A - pours hazy golden orange with almost no white head. S - sour, sour aromas of fruit (grapefruit, pineapple, pit fruit), vinegar, eggs, apple and funk. M - strong bodied sour brew. T - sour dried apricot, pineapple, lemon, on the nose. The same with funk, horse blanket. Lingering tart fruits and funk. Very fruity brew.  O - good sour brew. 7/7+

Bottle at Kulminator, March 2012. Unknown vintage.

Hazy dark golden with a small white head. Tart aroma with fruit, wood and yeasy. The same in the refreshing taste. This was a tart Gueuze but not extremely tart. I must drink more beers from Hanssens.

Bottle. Pour Is hazy deep copper with a small, quickly dissipating head. Aroma is gym sock, faint cereal malt, horse,  faint hay, and a touch if lemon. Flavor is funky, tart, woody, more funk, and a touch of dryness. Excellent

Pours orangish brown with a big off white head.  Nose is earthy and light fruit with a hint of vinegar but not as much as I had expected.  Flavor is sweet throughout with a good sour presence on the finish.  Mouthfeel is crisp and clean with a long aftertaste.  I would like to have this when its a bit older.
Sampled @ 5de Brugs Bierfestival, Brugge. Cloudy copper with a real head. Hoppy, floral aroma. Pleasantly sour flavour. Positively surprised at how good this was.

Bottle from Beers of Europe
Dark yellow amber...clear....fizzy white head..dissipates to thin layer around glass
Aroma - Light cider...tart....bit of barnyard...hint of yeast...bit of straw
Taste - Fresh tart biting sour light apple..lemon...sour citrus fruits...haribo tangfantastics....quite fruity...hint of sherbet.. bitterness underneath...some straw
Palate - medium carb....light body....biting sour acidity for a few seconds but clean and crisp. Finish...very dry....mouthpuckering....sour bitterness...some citrus fruits in there....clean finish
Overall - My first gueuze and its not the last!

UPDATED: JUL 21, 2014 12.7oz bottle in a tulip.  Pours darker than golden with a lacy, off-white head.  Aroma of sourness and sweet tarts, some spiciness, a little dough and caramel, and light hops.  Flavor the same, with a lot of tartness and a little light fruits.  Sparkling texture.  A pretty good gueuze.  Edit: 750ml bottle.  Pours hazy golden/amber.  Aroma of sourness and funkiness, light oak, some light malts.  Flavor a great blend. Average texture for the style. Definitely deserved better than 3.8 which I gave it the first time.

Bottled, unknown vintage.  Poured apple juice golden with just some wisps of white head.  The aroma picked up juicy and tart lighter fruit skins and vinegar paired with some horse blankets and damp earth.. mildly assertive, and just interesting enough.  The flavor opened acidic with lemon rind, apricot skins, and vinegar taking a layer off of the tongue.. aged oak joined in a similar vein on the middle.. fruity meat and musty barn deeper down.. finished sour and refreshing.  Low carbonation and moderate-high overall acidity on the palate.. puckering and engaging the whole way through.. really good stuff!

Bottle at Den Dyver Brugge. Food Pairing: Squid, sardines, croutons of smoked eel. Zucchini and millefeuille.
Ambergold color with immediately disappearing head.
Aroma is sour but the taste was not as sour as expected. Fizzy feeling.

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2012 Light hazy, full golden body and thin white head. Lemon, champagne, accessible. Very sour taste, squicky teeth and shrinking lips. But a woody complexity to balance and impress. Leaves a long and flavourful after taste. (375ml bottle, affordable)
Bottle. Pours a hazy orange with very little head. Aroma is mostly funk with a little spice. Taste is lemon, citrus, and barnyard. Very acidic. Overall pretty refreshing.
UPDATED: JUN 5, 2013 Sour, acidic. Nice amber color. Aroma of citrus and green apple. Very refreshing geuze, one of the most sour i tasted.

Bärnstensfärgad lätt grumlig med ett flyktigt vitt skum. Komplex doft av grönmögelost, trä, gröna äpplen och torrt vitt vin. Sur smak som drar åt torr cider. Inte lika komplex som doften. En bra Gueuze.
Pours a clear amber. Thin white head. Aroma is sour. Flavors is even more sour. Delicious.

UPDATED: NOV 29, 2012 Beautiful golden color. Nose is discreet. Taste is highly citric. Not much other favors/sensations to offer than bone dry acidity. Not such a fan of this type of Gueuze. Too radical for me.
#1174 bottle; nose is heavy barn yard, velvet brett note, hay, red grape, feel is medium, carb is mediumheavy, taste is sour earth, barn yard, winegum, red grape

375 ml bottle. Poured with minimal carbonation. Great funky aroma, tons of earthy notes. Lemon/citrus dominates the palate. Earthy/barnyard notes are plentiful but this gueuze is citrus/tart forward. Very enjoyable.

375 ml bottle bough @ Bierkompass.de and consumed on December 13. Pours hazy golden with a small creamy white head that slowly dissipates. Smell is sour with leather, dust, farmyard, grapefruit, lemon, lemon zest, raisins and pipe tobacco. Taste is sour and tart with lemon juice, apples, leather, metal, earth, hay, grass, wood and green grapes. Finish is dry and sour.

Clear almost amber golden body with lively carbonation and a whitish foam that dies quickly.  Aroma is a dull acidity, hay.  Taste is a puckering sourness, but not outwardly acidic, earthy, hay and grass.  It isnt mindblowing sour but it is enjoyable.

The weirdness of gueuze always intrigues me.  What the hell is this stuff?  Its like champagne made out of beer.  I know, theres all sorts of wild bacteria and open fermentation and blah-de-blah-de-blah, but that does little to explain the sourdough bread meets lemon juice flavor that permeates Hanssens Oude Gueze.  And, while it is good, I find it a little too breadlike and earthy, to the point where the tartness takes an odd muddy turn.  Still, a good gueuze, if a bit much for one man to handle.
Fra flaske i Hanssens Artisanaal under Tour de Geuze 2011. Mørk gylden. Uklar. OK skum som varer en kort stund. Syrlig pepperaroma. Litt kvass. Smaken er aggressivt syrlig pepper.

Pours a clear light copper color with a bubbly white head. Nose is very tart citrus fruit, funky yeast, earthy and oak. Flavor is nice tart citrus and lemon, sweet and sour balance. Dry finish and mouth watering.

Bouteille de 750 ml, lors du Bières et Bouffe 2011. Arômes de vieille cave humide, de brettanomyces et de chêne. Robe orangée assez pâle, plutôt trouble, effervescence moyenne et peu de mousse. Très acide en bouche, la très forte présence lactique et acétique prend vraiment le dessus sur les saveurs plus subtiles du lambic. On note tout de même un caractère particulier de bois humide et de légères notes citronnées. Texture légèrement visqueuse en bouche. Finale très acide et très sèche. Je préfère de loin les gueuzes moins acides et plus raffinées.

375ml bottle at BenCs semi-blind gueuze tasting - Pours lightly hazy amber with a small light tan head. Lemony on the nose with a little sharp citrus, oak, and just a touch of funk. For the taste, the tartness builds slowly until its pretty full and tart in the mouth. Citrusy and clean, without a whole lot of sharp edges. Pretty slick in the mouth, not a ton of carbonation.
Bottle at home - an attempt to see if the wife would like it... Not so much. That being said, this is a really nice beer! Good funk and sour notes. Easy to enjoy!

Aroma of hay, white grape, tart apple, damp basement. Appearance is translucent gold with bone head, nice lacing. Flavor matches the nose; really quite tart (occasionally inducing a cough) but I didnt mind this so much. Palate is bubbly. Very nice Gueuze.
Bottle.  Pours a hazy orange gold with very little head.  Aroma of tart fruit.  Taste is sour fruit, tart fruit, citrus and a bit of vinegar.  New to style.

Bottle.  A hazy golden beer with a thin white head.  Sour aroma of citrus, cheese.  Taste is sour, a bit fruity, with a barnyard/cheesy/earthy flavor as it hits the back of my throat, which lingers a bit.

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2011 (Update for clarity): Lets get one thing perfectly clear right off the bat - Hanssens aint messing around when it comes to Lambics.  This beer brings some serious funk, along with a little junk in the trunk to go with it.  Pours a cloudy gold with no head to speak of.  Nose is funky, sour, barnyard, crotch cheese and citrus.  I really like the crotch cheese note - it reminds me of a girl I knew in college.  (As a side note, this girls nickname was "Chicken wing".  Pronounced Chick-En-Waaaang.  Not because of anything special she did with chicken wings, no - because her naughty bits smelled faintly of the blue cheese that often accompanies chicken wings.  So no you know where Im coming from (or where I came from)).  Plenty of sour and funk to go around - the taste is amazing.  Good stuff.  World class.

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2016 
37,5 cl bottle @ Gastropub Tuulensuu. Rated on 25.09.2010
